entries.name: ackermann_vehicle
entries.description:
ackermann_vehicle is a group of packages for simulating a vehicle with
    Ackermann steering.

entries.name: ackermann_vehicle_description
entries.description:
ackermann_vehicle_description contains the description (3D model,
    kinematics, mass, etc.) of a vehicle with Ackermann steering.

entries.name: ackermann_vehicle_gazebo
entries.description:
ackermann_vehicle_gazebo is used with Gazebo to simulate a vehicle with
    Ackermann steering.

entries.name: actionlib
entries.description:
The actionlib stack provides a standardized interface for
    interfacing with preemptable tasks. Examples of this include moving
    the base to a target location, performing a laser scan and returning
    the resulting point cloud, detecting the handle of a door, etc.

entries.name: angles
entries.description:
This package provides a set of simple math utilities to work
        with angles. The utilities cover simple things like
        normalizing an angle and conversion between degrees and
        radians. But even if you're trying to calculate things like
        the shortest angular distance between two joinst space
        positions of your robot, but the joint motion is constrained
        by joint limits, this package is what you need. The code in
        this packge is stable and well tested. There are no plans for
        major changes in the near future.

entries.name: ardrone_autonomy
entries.description: ardrone_autonomy is a ROS driver for Parrot AR-Drone quadrocopter. This driver is based on official AR-Drone SDK version 2.0.1. The driver supports both AR-Drone 1.0 and 2.0. ardrone_autonomy is a fork of AR-Drone Brown driver. This package has been developed in Autonomy Lab of Simon Fraser University.
entries.readme:
ardrone_autonomy ROS Driver ARDrone [![](http://jenkins.ros.org/buildStatus/icon?job=devel-hydro-ardrone_autonomy)](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-hydro-ardrone_autonomy) ardrone_autonomy [ROS](http://ros.org/ "Robot Operating System") driver [Parrot AR-Drone](http://ardrone2.parrot.com/) quadrocopter. driver based official [AR-Drone SDK](https://projects.ardrone.org/) version driver supports AR-Drone "ardrone_autonomy" fork [AR-Drone Brown](http://code.google.com/p/brown-ros-pkg/wiki/ardrone_brown) driver. package developed [Autonomy Lab](http://autonomy.cs.sfu.ca) [Simon Fraser University](http://www.sfu.ca) [Mani Monajjemi](http://sfu.ca/~mmonajje) [contributors](#contributors)). Table Contents [Updates](#updates) [Installation](#installation) [Binary Install](#binary-install) [Compile Install Source](#compile-and-install-from-source) Run](#how-to-run) [Reading AR-Drone](#reading-from-ar-drone) [Update Frequencies ](#update-frequencies-new) [Legacy Navigation Data](#legacy-navigation-data) [IMU data](#imu-data) [Magnetometer Data](#magnetometer-data) [Selective Navdata (Advanced) ](#selective-navdata-advanced-new) [Cameras](#cameras) [Tag Detection](#tag-detection) [Update Frequencies](#update-frequencies) [Sending Commands AR-Drone](#sending-commands-to-ar-drone) [Hover Modes ](#hover-modes-new) [Coordinate Frames](#coordinate-frames) [Services](#services) [Toggle AR-Drone's Camera](#toggle-ar-drones-camera) [LED Animations](#led-animations) [Flight Animations ](#flight-animations-new) [IMU Calibration](#imu-calibration) [Flat Trim](#flat-trim) [Record USB Stick](#record-to-usb-stick) [Parameters](#parameters) [AR-Drone Specific Parameters](#ar-drone-specific-parameters) Parameters](#other-parameters) [License](#license) [Contributors](#contributors) [FAQ](#faq) Updates *September [Bug Fixes Minor Improvements](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/milestones/1.3.5) *March binary packages driver built [ROS build farm](http://wiki.ros.org/BuildFarm). install driver ROS _Hydro_ _Groovy_ `apt-get` _Ubuntu_. *January Fully _catkinized_ package ([#75](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/75) [#79](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/79)). ARDroneLib configured built external project. ARDroneLib replaced vanilla SDK's stripped tarball. info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/80)). *October Update Parrot SDK (Fixes crashes firmwares, support flight recorder check FAQ section instructions re-compile SDK**. (Tested firmwares) *February Support USB key recording info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/53)). Motor PWM added legacy Navdata. *January ROS Groovy support. Support zero-command hovering info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/34)). Full configurable Navdata support info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/31)). Support "Flight Animations". Support Real-time navdata video publishing info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/44)). Support configurable data publishing rate. *November Critical Bug sending configurations drone fixed parameters supported info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/issues/24)). Separate topic magnetometer data added info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/25)). *September Experimental automatic IMU bias removal. *August Thread-safe SDK data access. Synchronized `navdata` `camera` topics. *August driver ROS standard camera interface. *August Experimental support added. published topic `imu`. *August Enhanced `Navdata` message. `Navdata` includes magnetometer data, barometer data, temperature wind information AR-Drone [Issue #2](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/2) *July LED Animation Support added driver service *July Initial Public Release Installation Binary Install supported _Ubuntu_ platform ROS _Hydro_ _Groovy_ install driver `apt-get install ros-*-ardrone-autonomy` `apt-get install ros-hydro-ardrone-autonomy`. Compile Install Source bundled AR-Drone SDK build system handles system wide dependencies ROS package depends standard ROS packages: `roscpp`, `image_transport`, `sensor_msgs`, `camera_info_manager` `std_srvs`. installation steps needed compile ROS driver [catkin](http://wiki.ros.org/catkin). Clone download unpack) driver `src` folder existing catkin [workspace](http://wiki.ros.org/catkin/Tutorials/create_a_workspace) `~/catkin_ws/src`) `catkin_make` compile. Assuming compiling ROS _Hydro_: ```bash ~/catkin_ws/src git clone https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy.git hydro-devel ~/catkin_ws catkin_make compile older ROS distros bound `rosbuild`, check `fuerte-devel` branch. Run driver's executable node `ardrone_driver`. `rosrun ardrone_autonomy ardrone_driver` put custom launch file desired parameters. Reading AR-Drone Update Frequencies **Drone Update Frequencies**: drone's data transmission update frequency depends `navdata_demo` parameter. transmission frequency (`navdata_demo` numeric parameter Boolean, True/False) set/unset **Driver Update Frequencies**: driver operate modes: real-time fixed rate. `realtime_navdata` parameter set True, driver publish received information instantly. set False, driver cache received data, publish fixed rate, configured `looprate` parameter. default configuration `realtime_navdata=False` `looprate=50`. note `looprate` smaller drone's transmission frequency, data loss. driver's start-up output shows current configuration. `rostopic command check publish rate driver. 
 Default Setting non-realtime update, drone transmission rate rosrun ardrone_autonomy ardrone_driver _realtime_navdata:=False _navdata_demo:=0 real-time update rosrun ardrone_autonomy ardrone_driver _realtime_navdata:=True _navdata_demo:=0 real-rime update rosrun ardrone_autonomy ardrone_driver _realtime_navdata:=True _navdata_demo:=1
Legacy Navigation Data Information received drone published `ardrone/navdata` topic. message type `ardrone_autonomy::Navdata` information: `header`: ROS message header `batteryPercent`: remaining charge drone's battery `state`: Drone's current state: Unknown Inited Landed Flying Hovering Test Landing Looping `rotX`: Left/right tilt degrees (rotation axis) `rotY`: Forward/backward tilt degrees (rotation axis) `rotZ`: Orientation degrees (rotation axis) `magX`, `magY`, `magZ`: Magnetometer readings (AR-Drone (TBA: Convention) `pressure`: Pressure sensed Drone's barometer (AR-Drone `temp` Temperature sensed Drone's sensor (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_speed`: Estimated wind speed (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_angle`: Estimated wind angle (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_comp_angle`: Estimated wind angle compensation (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `altd`: Estimated altitude `motor1..4`: Motor PWM values Linear velocity (mm/s) [TBA: Convention] Linear acceleration [TBA: Convention] Timestamp data returned Drone returned number micro-seconds passed Drone's boot-up. **NOTE:** legacy Navdata publishing disabled setting `enable_legacy_navdata` parameter `False` (legacy navdata enabled default). IMU data linear acceleration, angular velocity orientation `Navdata` published standard ROS [`sensor_msgs/Imu`](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/Imu.html) message. units metric reference frame `Base` frame. topic experimental. covariance values specific parameters. Magnetometer Data normalized magnetometer readings published `ardrone/mag` topic standard ROS [`geometry_msgs/Vector3Stamped`](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/geometry_msgs/html/msg/Vector3Stamped.html) message. Selective Navdata (Advanced) access sensor readings, debug values status reports AR-Drone "Selective Navdata". set parameters "True", `Navdata` information published separate topic. enable `enable_navdata_time`, driver publish AR-Drone time information `ardrone/navdata_time` topic. names self-explanatory. consult AR-Drone SDK documentation source code) information. parameters set False default. 
 enable_navdata_trims enable_navdata_rc_references enable_navdata_pwm enable_navdata_altitude enable_navdata_vision_raw enable_navdata_vision_of enable_navdata_vision enable_navdata_vision_perf enable_navdata_trackers_send enable_navdata_vision_detect enable_navdata_watchdog enable_navdata_adc_data_frame enable_navdata_video_stream enable_navdata_games enable_navdata_pressure_raw enable_navdata_magneto enable_navdata_wind_speed enable_navdata_kalman_pressure enable_navdata_hdvideo_stream enable_navdata_wifi enable_navdata_zimmu_3000
**HINT:** `rostopic type ardrone/navdata_time rosmsg show` command topic inspect published message's data structure. Cameras AR-Drone equipped cameras. frontal camera pointing vertical camera pointing downward. driver create topics drone: `ardrone/image_raw`, `ardrone/front/image_raw` `ardrone/bottom/image_raw`. standard [ROS camera interface](http://ros.org/wiki/camera_drivers) publish messages type [image transport](http://www.ros.org/wiki/image_transport). driver standard [ROS camera driver](http://www.ros.org/wiki/camera_drivers), therefor camera calibration information set ROS parameters `ardrone_front.yaml` and/or `ardrone_bottom.yaml`, information published `camera_info` topics. check FAQ section information. `ardrone/*` selected camera's video stream information. streams work depend type Drone. Drone Drone supports modes video streams: Front camera bottom camera front camera bottom camera (picture picture) bottom camera front camera (picture picture). active configuration mode, driver decomposes PIP stream publishes pure front/bottom streams topics. `camera_info` topic include correct image size. Drone Drone support PIP feature anymore, `ardrone/front` `ardrone/bottom` topics updated based camera selected time. Tag Detection `Navdata` message returns special tags detected Drone's on-board vision processing system. learn system works consult AR-Drone SDK [developers guide](https://projects.ardrone.org/projects/show/ardrone-api/). tags detected drone's video cameras on-board 30fps. configure disable) feature "Parameters" section documentation. detected tags' type position Drone's camera frame published variables `Navdata` message: `tags_count`: number detected tags. `tags_type[]`: Vector types detected tags (details `tags_xc[]`, `tags_yc[]`, `tags_width[]`, `tags_height[]`: Vector position components size components tag. numbers expressed numbers convert pixel unit camera's resolution obtained front `camera_info` topic). `tags_orientation[]`: tags support orientation, vector tag orientation expressed degrees default, driver configure drone _oriented roundels_ bottom camera tags indoor shells (_orange-yellow_) front camera. information extract information `tags_type` field. Check FAQ section Update Frequencies TBA. Sending Commands AR-Drone drone *takeoff*, *land* *emergency stop/reset* publishing `Empty` ROS messages topics: `ardrone/takeoff`, `ardrone/land` `ardrone/reset` order fly drone takeoff, publish message type [`geometry_msgs::Twist`](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/geometry_msgs/html/msg/Twist.html) `cmd_vel` topic. -linear.x: move +linear.x: move -linear.y: move +linear.y: move left -linear.z: move +linear.z: move -angular.z: turn left +angular.z: turn range component maximum range configured ROS parameters discussed document. Hover Modes `geometry_msgs::Twist` member variable called `angular.x` `angular.y` enable/disable "auto-hover" mode. "auto-hover" enabled components set drone enter "auto hover" mode cases set components set `angular.x` `angular.y` arbitrary **non-zero** values. Coordinate Frames driver publishes [`tf`](http://www.ros.org/wiki/tf) transforms reference frames: `${tf_prefix}/${base_prefix}_link`, `${tf_prefix}/${base_prefix}_frontcam` `${tf_prefix}/${base_prefix}_bottomcam`. `${tf_prefix}` ROS standard handle multi-robot trees set `tf_prefix` parameters, default empty. `${base_link}` shared prefix reference frames set parameters, default `ardrone_base`. default parameters, frames `ardrone_base_link`, `ardrone_base_frontcam` `ardrone_base_bottomcam`. default root frame `ardrone_base_link`. Therefor `ardrone_base_frontcam` `ardrone_base_bottomcam` children `ardrone_base_link` published tree. changed `root_frame` parameter. `frame_id` field header published topics (navdata, imu, cameras) frame names. frames [ROS REP 103](http://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0103.html) compatible. Services Toggle AR-Drone's Camera Calling `ardrone/togglecam` service parameters change active video camera stream. `rosservice call /ardrone/togglecam`). `ardrone/setcamchannel` service sets current active camera channel. parameter (`uint8 channel service. AR-Drone valid values AR-Drone valid values order similar order "Cameras" section. LED Animations Calling `ardrone/setledanimation` service invoke pre-defined LED animations drone. parameters `uint8 type`: type animation number range `float32 freq`: frequency animation `uint8 duration`: duration animation Seconds. `type` parameter map order] animations (check `srv/LedAnim.srv` details): BLINK_GREEN_RED, BLINK_GREEN, BLINK_RED, BLINK_ORANGE, SNAKE_GREEN_RED, FIRE, STANDARD, RED, GREEN, RED_SNAKE,BLANK, LEFT_GREEN_RIGHT_RED, LEFT_RED_RIGHT_GREEN, BLINK_STANDARD` test animations command line commands `rosservice call /ardrone/setledanimation Flight Animations Calling `ardrone/setflightanimation` service execute pre-defined flight animations drone. parameters `uint8 type`: type flight animation, number range `uint16 duration`: duration animation. default duration (recommended) `type` parameter map order] pre-defined animations (check `srv/FlightAnim.srv` details): ARDRONE_ANIM_PHI_M30_DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_PHI_30_DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_M30_DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_30_DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_20DEG_YAW_200DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_20DEG_YAW_M200DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_TURNAROUND, ARDRONE_ANIM_TURNAROUND_GODOWN, ARDRONE_ANIM_YAW_SHAKE, ARDRONE_ANIM_YAW_DANCE, ARDRONE_ANIM_PHI_DANCE, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_DANCE, ARDRONE_ANIM_VZ_DANCE, ARDRONE_ANIM_WAVE, ARDRONE_ANIM_PHI_THETA_MIXED, ARDRONE_ANIM_DOUBLE_PHI_THETA_MIXED, ARDRONE_ANIM_FLIP_AHEAD, ARDRONE_ANIM_FLIP_BEHIND, ARDRONE_ANIM_FLIP_LEFT, ARDRONE_ANIM_FLIP_RIGHT test animations command line commands `rosservice call /ardrone/setflightanimation drone flying. extra cautious animations, flip animations. IMU Calibration `do_imu_caliberation` parameter set true, calling `ardrone/imu_recalib` service driver recalculate biases IMU data based data short sampling period. Flat Trim Calling `ardrone/flattrim` service parameter send "Flat Trim" request AR-Drone re-calibrate rotation estimates assuming flat surface. call service Drone flying drone flat surface. Record USB Stick Calling `ardrone/setrecord` service enable disable recording USB stick. service takes simple enable disable. turn recording USB stick `rosservice call /ardrone/setrecord Parameters AR-Drone Specific Parameters parameters listed named AR-Drone's SDK configuration. set parameters `rosparam` `launch` file, default values values applied driver's initialization phase. refer AR-Drone SDK [developer's guide](https://projects.ardrone.org/projects/show/ardrone-api/) information valid values. parameters needed regular usage AR-Drone, consult launch file `launch/ardrone.launch` frequent parameters. altitude, altitude_max, altitude_min, ardrone_name, autonomous_flight, bitrate, bitrate_ctrl_mode, bitrate_storage, codec_fps, com_watchdog, control_iphone_tilt, control_level, control_vz_max, control_yaw, detect_type, detections_select_h, detections_select_v, detections_select_v_hsync, enemy_colors, enemy_without_shell, euler_angle_max, flight_anim, flight_without_shell, flying_mode, groundstripe_colors, hovering_range, indoor_control_vz_max, indoor_control_yaw, indoor_euler_angle_max, latitude, leds_anim, longitude, manual_trim, max_bitrate, max_size, navdata_demo, navdata_options, nb_files, outdoor, outdoor_control_vz_max, outdoor_control_yaw, outdoor_euler_angle_max, output, owner_mac, ssid_multi_player, ssid_single_player, travelling_enable, travelling_mode, ultrasound_freq, ultrasound_watchdog, userbox_cmd, video_channel, video_codec, video_enable, video_file_index, video_live_socket, video_on_usb, video_slices, vision_enable, wifi_mode, wifi_rate wiki page](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/wiki/AR-Drone-Parameters) includes information parameters. Parameters parameters control behaviour driver. `drone_frame_id` "frame_id" prefix frame names default: "ardrone_base" `root_frame` default root drone's tree _link, _frontcam, _bottomcam) Default: `cov/imu_la`, `cov/imu_av` `cov/imu_or`: List covariance values `imu`'s topic linear acceleration, angular velocity orientation fields Default: members check FAQ section sample launch file shows set values) `do_imu_calibration`: [EXPERIMENTAL] drone cancel biases IMU data Default: `enable_legacy_navdata`: Enable legacy `Navdata` publish Default: True License Parrot's license, copyright disclaimer `ARDroneLib`]https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardronelib/blob/master/LICENSE) parts code subject `BSD` license. Table Contents [Updates](#updates) [Installation](#installation) [Binary Install](#binary-install) [Compile Install Source](#compile-and-install-from-source) Run](#how-to-run) [Reading AR-Drone](#reading-from-ar-drone) [Update Frequencies ](#update-frequencies-new) [Legacy Navigation Data](#legacy-navigation-data) [IMU data](#imu-data) [Magnetometer Data](#magnetometer-data) [Selective Navdata (Advanced) ](#selective-navdata-advanced-new) [Cameras](#cameras) [Tag Detection](#tag-detection) [Update Frequencies](#update-frequencies) [Sending Commands AR-Drone](#sending-commands-to-ar-drone) [Hover Modes ](#hover-modes-new) [Coordinate Frames](#coordinate-frames) [Services](#services) [Toggle AR-Drone's Camera](#toggle-ar-drones-camera) [LED Animations](#led-animations) [Flight Animations ](#flight-animations-new) [IMU Calibration](#imu-calibration) [Flat Trim](#flat-trim) [Record USB Stick](#record-to-usb-stick) [Parameters](#parameters) [AR-Drone Specific Parameters](#ar-drone-specific-parameters) Parameters](#other-parameters) [License](#license) [Contributors](#contributors) [FAQ](#faq) Updates *September [Bug Fixes Minor Improvements](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/milestones/1.3.5) *March binary packages driver built [ROS build farm](http://wiki.ros.org/BuildFarm). install driver ROS _Hydro_ _Groovy_ `apt-get` _Ubuntu_. *January Fully _catkinized_ package ([#75](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/75) [#79](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/79)). ARDroneLib configured built external project. ARDroneLib replaced vanilla SDK's stripped tarball. info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/80)). *October Update Parrot SDK (Fixes crashes firmwares, support flight recorder check FAQ section instructions re-compile SDK**. (Tested firmwares) *February Support USB key recording info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/53)). Motor PWM added legacy Navdata. *January ROS Groovy support. Support zero-command hovering info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/34)). Full configurable Navdata support info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/31)). Support "Flight Animations". Support Real-time navdata video publishing info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/44)). Support configurable data publishing rate. *November Critical Bug sending configurations drone fixed parameters supported info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/issues/24)). Separate topic magnetometer data added info](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/25)). *September Experimental automatic IMU bias removal. *August Thread-safe SDK data access. Synchronized `navdata` `camera` topics. *August driver ROS standard camera interface. *August Experimental support added. published topic `imu`. *August Enhanced `Navdata` message. `Navdata` includes magnetometer data, barometer data, temperature wind information AR-Drone [Issue #2](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/2) *July LED Animation Support added driver service *July Initial Public Release Installation Binary Install supported _Ubuntu_ platform ROS _Hydro_ _Groovy_ install driver `apt-get install ros-*-ardrone-autonomy` `apt-get install ros-hydro-ardrone-autonomy`. Compile Install Source bundled AR-Drone SDK build system handles system wide dependencies ROS package depends standard ROS packages: `roscpp`, `image_transport`, `sensor_msgs`, `camera_info_manager` `std_srvs`. installation steps needed compile ROS driver [catkin](http://wiki.ros.org/catkin). Clone download unpack) driver `src` folder existing catkin [workspace](http://wiki.ros.org/catkin/Tutorials/create_a_workspace) `~/catkin_ws/src`) `catkin_make` compile. Assuming compiling ROS _Hydro_: ```bash ~/catkin_ws/src git clone https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy.git hydro-devel ~/catkin_ws catkin_make compile older ROS distros bound `rosbuild`, check `fuerte-devel` branch. Run driver's executable node `ardrone_driver`. `rosrun ardrone_autonomy ardrone_driver` put custom launch file desired parameters. Reading AR-Drone Update Frequencies **Drone Update Frequencies**: drone's data transmission update frequency depends `navdata_demo` parameter. transmission frequency (`navdata_demo` numeric parameter Boolean, True/False) set/unset **Driver Update Frequencies**: driver operate modes: real-time fixed rate. `realtime_navdata` parameter set True, driver publish received information instantly. set False, driver cache received data, publish fixed rate, configured `looprate` parameter. default configuration `realtime_navdata=False` `looprate=50`. note `looprate` smaller drone's transmission frequency, data loss. driver's start-up output shows current configuration. `rostopic command check publish rate driver. 
 Default Setting non-realtime update, drone transmission rate rosrun ardrone_autonomy ardrone_driver _realtime_navdata:=False _navdata_demo:=0 real-time update rosrun ardrone_autonomy ardrone_driver _realtime_navdata:=True _navdata_demo:=0 real-rime update rosrun ardrone_autonomy ardrone_driver _realtime_navdata:=True _navdata_demo:=1
Legacy Navigation Data Information received drone published `ardrone/navdata` topic. message type `ardrone_autonomy::Navdata` information: `header`: ROS message header `batteryPercent`: remaining charge drone's battery `state`: Drone's current state: Unknown Inited Landed Flying Hovering Test Landing Looping `rotX`: Left/right tilt degrees (rotation axis) `rotY`: Forward/backward tilt degrees (rotation axis) `rotZ`: Orientation degrees (rotation axis) `magX`, `magY`, `magZ`: Magnetometer readings (AR-Drone (TBA: Convention) `pressure`: Pressure sensed Drone's barometer (AR-Drone `temp` Temperature sensed Drone's sensor (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_speed`: Estimated wind speed (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_angle`: Estimated wind angle (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_comp_angle`: Estimated wind angle compensation (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `altd`: Estimated altitude `motor1..4`: Motor PWM values Linear velocity (mm/s) [TBA: Convention] Linear acceleration [TBA: Convention] Timestamp data returned Drone returned number micro-seconds passed Drone's boot-up. **NOTE:** legacy Navdata publishing disabled setting `enable_legacy_navdata` parameter `False` (legacy navdata enabled default). IMU data linear acceleration, angular velocity orientation `Navdata` published standard ROS [`sensor_msgs/Imu`](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/Imu.html) message. units metric reference frame `Base` frame. topic experimental. covariance values specific parameters. Magnetometer Data normalized magnetometer readings published `ardrone/mag` topic standard ROS [`geometry_msgs/Vector3Stamped`](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/geometry_msgs/html/msg/Vector3Stamped.html) message. Selective Navdata (Advanced) access sensor readings, debug values status reports AR-Drone "Selective Navdata". set parameters "True", `Navdata` information published separate topic. enable `enable_navdata_time`, driver publish AR-Drone time information `ardrone/navdata_time` topic. names self-explanatory. consult AR-Drone SDK documentation source code) information. parameters set False default. 
 enable_navdata_trims enable_navdata_rc_references enable_navdata_pwm enable_navdata_altitude enable_navdata_vision_raw enable_navdata_vision_of enable_navdata_vision enable_navdata_vision_perf enable_navdata_trackers_send enable_navdata_vision_detect enable_navdata_watchdog enable_navdata_adc_data_frame enable_navdata_video_stream enable_navdata_games enable_navdata_pressure_raw enable_navdata_magneto enable_navdata_wind_speed enable_navdata_kalman_pressure enable_navdata_hdvideo_stream enable_navdata_wifi enable_navdata_zimmu_3000
**HINT:** `rostopic type ardrone/navdata_time rosmsg show` command topic inspect published message's data structure. Cameras AR-Drone equipped cameras. frontal camera pointing vertical camera pointing downward. driver create topics drone: `ardrone/image_raw`, `ardrone/front/image_raw` `ardrone/bottom/image_raw`. standard [ROS camera interface](http://ros.org/wiki/camera_drivers) publish messages type [image transport](http://www.ros.org/wiki/image_transport). driver standard [ROS camera driver](http://www.ros.org/wiki/camera_drivers), therefor camera calibration information set ROS parameters `ardrone_front.yaml` and/or `ardrone_bottom.yaml`, information published `camera_info` topics. check FAQ section information. `ardrone/*` selected camera's video stream information. streams work depend type Drone. Drone Drone supports modes video streams: Front camera bottom camera front camera bottom camera (picture picture) bottom camera front camera (picture picture). active configuration mode, driver decomposes PIP stream publishes pure front/bottom streams topics. `camera_info` topic include correct image size. Drone Drone support PIP feature anymore, `ardrone/front` `ardrone/bottom` topics updated based camera selected time. Tag Detection `Navdata` message returns special tags detected Drone's on-board vision processing system. learn system works consult AR-Drone SDK [developers guide](https://projects.ardrone.org/projects/show/ardrone-api/). tags detected drone's video cameras on-board 30fps. configure disable) feature "Parameters" section documentation. detected tags' type position Drone's camera frame published variables `Navdata` message: `tags_count`: number detected tags. `tags_type[]`: Vector types detected tags (details `tags_xc[]`, `tags_yc[]`, `tags_width[]`, `tags_height[]`: Vector position components size components tag. numbers expressed numbers convert pixel unit camera's resolution obtained front `camera_info` topic). `tags_orientation[]`: tags support orientation, vector tag orientation expressed degrees default, driver configure drone _oriented roundels_ bottom camera tags indoor shells (_orange-yellow_) front camera. information extract information `tags_type` field. Check FAQ section Update Frequencies TBA. Sending Commands AR-Drone drone *takeoff*, *land* *emergency stop/reset* publishing `Empty` ROS messages topics: `ardrone/takeoff`, `ardrone/land` `ardrone/reset` order fly drone takeoff, publish message type [`geometry_msgs::Twist`](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/geometry_msgs/html/msg/Twist.html) `cmd_vel` topic. -linear.x: move +linear.x: move -linear.y: move +linear.y: move left -linear.z: move +linear.z: move -angular.z: turn left +angular.z: turn range component maximum range configured ROS parameters discussed document. Hover Modes `geometry_msgs::Twist` member variable called `angular.x` `angular.y` enable/disable "auto-hover" mode. "auto-hover" enabled components set drone enter "auto hover" mode cases set components set `angular.x` `angular.y` arbitrary **non-zero** values. Coordinate Frames driver publishes [`tf`](http://www.ros.org/wiki/tf) transforms reference frames: `${tf_prefix}/${base_prefix}_link`, `${tf_prefix}/${base_prefix}_frontcam` `${tf_prefix}/${base_prefix}_bottomcam`. `${tf_prefix}` ROS standard handle multi-robot trees set `tf_prefix` parameters, default empty. `${base_link}` shared prefix reference frames set parameters, default `ardrone_base`. default parameters, frames `ardrone_base_link`, `ardrone_base_frontcam` `ardrone_base_bottomcam`. default root frame `ardrone_base_link`. Therefor `ardrone_base_frontcam` `ardrone_base_bottomcam` children `ardrone_base_link` published tree. changed `root_frame` parameter. `frame_id` field header published topics (navdata, imu, cameras) frame names. frames [ROS REP 103](http://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0103.html) compatible. Services Toggle AR-Drone's Camera Calling `ardrone/togglecam` service parameters change active video camera stream. `rosservice call /ardrone/togglecam`). `ardrone/setcamchannel` service sets current active camera channel. parameter (`uint8 channel service. AR-Drone valid values AR-Drone valid values order similar order "Cameras" section. LED Animations Calling `ardrone/setledanimation` service invoke pre-defined LED animations drone. parameters `uint8 type`: type animation number range `float32 freq`: frequency animation `uint8 duration`: duration animation Seconds. `type` parameter map order] animations (check `srv/LedAnim.srv` details): BLINK_GREEN_RED, BLINK_GREEN, BLINK_RED, BLINK_ORANGE, SNAKE_GREEN_RED, FIRE, STANDARD, RED, GREEN, RED_SNAKE,BLANK, LEFT_GREEN_RIGHT_RED, LEFT_RED_RIGHT_GREEN, BLINK_STANDARD` test animations command line commands `rosservice call /ardrone/setledanimation Flight Animations Calling `ardrone/setflightanimation` service execute pre-defined flight animations drone. parameters `uint8 type`: type flight animation, number range `uint16 duration`: duration animation. default duration (recommended) `type` parameter map order] pre-defined animations (check `srv/FlightAnim.srv` details): ARDRONE_ANIM_PHI_M30_DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_PHI_30_DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_M30_DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_30_DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_20DEG_YAW_200DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_20DEG_YAW_M200DEG, ARDRONE_ANIM_TURNAROUND, ARDRONE_ANIM_TURNAROUND_GODOWN, ARDRONE_ANIM_YAW_SHAKE, ARDRONE_ANIM_YAW_DANCE, ARDRONE_ANIM_PHI_DANCE, ARDRONE_ANIM_THETA_DANCE, ARDRONE_ANIM_VZ_DANCE, ARDRONE_ANIM_WAVE, ARDRONE_ANIM_PHI_THETA_MIXED, ARDRONE_ANIM_DOUBLE_PHI_THETA_MIXED, ARDRONE_ANIM_FLIP_AHEAD, ARDRONE_ANIM_FLIP_BEHIND, ARDRONE_ANIM_FLIP_LEFT, ARDRONE_ANIM_FLIP_RIGHT test animations command line commands `rosservice call /ardrone/setflightanimation drone flying. extra cautious animations, flip animations. IMU Calibration `do_imu_caliberation` parameter set true, calling `ardrone/imu_recalib` service driver recalculate biases IMU data based data short sampling period. Flat Trim Calling `ardrone/flattrim` service parameter send "Flat Trim" request AR-Drone re-calibrate rotation estimates assuming flat surface. call service Drone flying drone flat surface. Record USB Stick Calling `ardrone/setrecord` service enable disable recording USB stick. service takes simple enable disable. turn recording USB stick `rosservice call /ardrone/setrecord Parameters AR-Drone Specific Parameters parameters listed named AR-Drone's SDK configuration. set parameters `rosparam` `launch` file, default values values applied driver's initialization phase. refer AR-Drone SDK [developer's guide](https://projects.ardrone.org/projects/show/ardrone-api/) information valid values. parameters needed regular usage AR-Drone, consult launch file `launch/ardrone.launch` frequent parameters. altitude, altitude_max, altitude_min, ardrone_name, autonomous_flight, bitrate, bitrate_ctrl_mode, bitrate_storage, codec_fps, com_watchdog, control_iphone_tilt, control_level, control_vz_max, control_yaw, detect_type, detections_select_h, detections_select_v, detections_select_v_hsync, enemy_colors, enemy_without_shell, euler_angle_max, flight_anim, flight_without_shell, flying_mode, groundstripe_colors, hovering_range, indoor_control_vz_max, indoor_control_yaw, indoor_euler_angle_max, latitude, leds_anim, longitude, manual_trim, max_bitrate, max_size, navdata_demo, navdata_options, nb_files, outdoor, outdoor_control_vz_max, outdoor_control_yaw, outdoor_euler_angle_max, output, owner_mac, ssid_multi_player, ssid_single_player, travelling_enable, travelling_mode, ultrasound_freq, ultrasound_watchdog, userbox_cmd, video_channel, video_codec, video_enable, video_file_index, video_live_socket, video_on_usb, video_slices, vision_enable, wifi_mode, wifi_rate wiki page](https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/wiki/AR-Drone-Parameters) includes information parameters. Parameters parameters control behaviour driver. `drone_frame_id` "frame_id" prefix frame names default: "ardrone_base" `root_frame` default root drone's tree _link, _frontcam, _bottomcam) Default: `cov/imu_la`, `cov/imu_av` `cov/imu_or`: List covariance values `imu`'s topic linear acceleration, angular velocity orientation fields Default: members check FAQ section sample launch file shows set values) `do_imu_calibration`: [EXPERIMENTAL] drone cancel biases IMU data Default: `enable_legacy_navdata`: Enable legacy `Navdata` publish Default: True License Parrot's license, copyright disclaimer `ARDroneLib`]https://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardronelib/blob/master/LICENSE) parts code subject `BSD` license. entries.name: ardrone_autonomy
entries.description: ardrone_autonomy is a ROS driver for Parrot AR-Drone quadrocopter. This driver is based on official AR-Drone SDK version 2.0.1. The driver supports both AR-Drone 1.0 and 2.0. ardrone_autonomy is a fork of AR-Drone Brown driver. This package has been developed in Autonomy Lab of Simon Fraser University.

Legacy Navigation Data Information received drone published `ardrone/navdata` topic. message type `ardrone_autonomy::Navdata` information: `header`: ROS message header `batteryPercent`: remaining charge drone's battery `state`: Drone's current state: Unknown Inited Landed Flying Hovering Test Landing Looping `rotX`: Left/right tilt degrees (rotation axis) `rotY`: Forward/backward tilt degrees (rotation axis) `rotZ`: Orientation degrees (rotation axis) `magX`, `magY`, `magZ`: Magnetometer readings (AR-Drone (TBA: Convention) `pressure`: Pressure sensed Drone's barometer (AR-Drone `temp` Temperature sensed Drone's sensor (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_speed`: Estimated wind speed (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_angle`: Estimated wind angle (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `wind_comp_angle`: Estimated wind angle compensation (AR-Drone (TBA: Unit) `altd`: Estimated altitude `motor1..4`: Motor PWM values Linear velocity (mm/s) [TBA: Convention] Linear acceleration [TBA: Convention] Timestamp data returned Drone returned number micro-seconds passed Drone's boot-up. **NOTE:** legacy Navdata publishing disabled setting `enable_legacy_navdata` parameter `False` (legacy navdata enabled default). IMU data linear acceleration, angular velocity orientation `Navdata` published standard ROS [`sensor_msgs/Imu`](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/Imu.html) message. units metric reference frame `Base` frame. topic experimental. covariance values specific parameters. Magnetometer Data normalized magnetometer readings published `ardrone/mag` topic standard ROS [`geometry_msgs/Vector3Stamped`](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/geometry_msgs/html/msg/Vector3Stamped.html) message. Selective Navdata (Advanced) access sensor readings, debug values status reports AR-Drone "Selective Navdata". set parameters "True", `Navdata` information published separate topic. enable `enable_navdata_time`, driver publish AR-Drone time information `ardrone/navdata_time` topic. names self-explanatory. consult AR-Drone SDK documentation source code) information. parameters set False default. 
 enable_navdata_trims enable_navdata_rc_references enable_navdata_pwm enable_navdata_altitude enable_navdata_vision_raw enable_navdata_vision_of enable_navdata_vision enable_navdata_vision_perf enable_navdata_trackers_send enable_navdata_vision_detect enable_navdata_watchdog enable_navdata_adc_data_frame enable_navdata_video_stream enable_navdata_games enable_navdata_pressure_raw enable_navdata_magneto enable_navdata_wind_speed enable_navdata_kalman_pressure enable_navdata_hdvideo_stream enable_navdata_wifi enable_navdata_zimmu_3000
**HINT:** `rostopic type ardrone/navdata_time rosmsg show` command topic inspect published message's data structure. Cameras AR-Drone equipped cameras. frontal camera pointing vertical camera pointing downward. driver create topics drone: `ardrone/image_raw`, `ardrone/front/image_raw` `ardrone/bottom/image_raw`. standard [ROS camera interface](http://ros.org/wiki/camera_drivers) publish messages type [image transport](http://www.ros.org/wiki/image_transport). driver standard [ROS camera driver](http://www.ros.org/wiki/camera_drivers), therefor camera calibration information set ROS parameters `ardrone_front.yaml` and/or `ardrone_bottom.yaml`, information published `camera_info` topics. check FAQ section information. `ardrone/*` selected camera's video stream information. streams work depend type Drone. entries.name: bond
entries.description:
A bond allows two processes, A and B, to know when the other has
    terminated, either cleanly or by crashing.  The bond remains
    connected until it is either broken explicitly or until a
    heartbeat times out.

entries.name: smclib
entries.description:
The State Machine Compiler (SMC) from http://smc.sourceforge.net/
    converts a language-independent description of a state machine
    into the source code to support that state machine.

    This package contains the libraries that a compiled state machine
    depends on, but it does not contain the compiler itself.

entries.name: class_loader
entries.description: The class_loader package is a ROS-independent package for loading plugins during runtime and the foundation of the higher level ROS "pluginlib" library. class_loader utilizes the host operating system's runtime loader to open runtime libraries (e.g. .so/.dll files), introspect the library for exported plugin classes, and allows users to instantiate objects of said exported classes without the explicit declaration (i.e. header file) for those classes.

entries.name: cmake_modules
entries.description: A common repository for CMake Modules which are not distributed with CMake but are commonly used by ROS packages.
entries.readme: cmake_modules common repository CMake Modules distributed CMake commonly ROS packages. CONTRIBUTING.md file repository submitting pull requests modules. Modules [**Eigen**](http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/index.php?title=Main_Page) template library linear algebra: matrices, vectors, numerical solvers, related algorithms. [**NumPy**](http://www.numpy.org/) fundamental package scientific computing Python. [**TBB**](https://www.threadingbuildingblocks.org/) lets easily write parallel programs full advantage multicore performance. [**TinyXML**](http://www.grinninglizard.com/tinyxml/) simple, small, XML parser. [**Xenomai**](http://www.xenomai.org/) real-time development framework cooperating Linux kernel. [**GSL**] (http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/) numerical library programmers. Usage CMake modules catkin package, `<build_depend>` `package.xml`, ```xml <?xml version="1.0"?> <package> <build_depend>cmake_modules</build_depend> </package> `find_package` `CMakeLists.txt` catkin build dependencies: ```cmake find_package(catkin REQUIRED COMPONENTS cmake_modules `find_package`'ing ```cmake find_package(cmake_modules REQUIRED) `find_package` invocations, modules `cmake_modules` `CMAKE_MODULE_PATH` find `Eigen` ```cmake find_package(Eigen REQUIRED) Lookup sheet Eigen ```cmake find_package(Eigen REQUIRED) NumPY ```cmake find_package(NUMPY REQUIRED) TBB ```cmake find_package(TBB REQUIRED) TinyXML ```cmake find_package(TinyXML REQUIRED) Xenomai ```cmake find_package(Xenomai REQUIRED) FindGSL ```cmake find_package(GSL REQUIRED)

entries.name: cob_hardware_interface
entries.description:
This package implements the cob_hardware_interface.
    The interface uses topic communication rather than direct pointer access to the drivers.
    I.e. it publishs the desired velocity to a topic and reads from the /joint_states topic.
    Thus, it can be used for both velocity-controlled real hardware as well as velocity-controlled simulation (i.e. using the JointVelocityControllers)

entries.name: cob_canopen_motor
entries.description: The package cob_canopen_motor implements a controller-drive component which is connected to a can-bus and works with a canopen-interface. "CanDriveItf" provides a - more or less - generic interface to the controller-drive components. "CanDrvie..." then implements a specific setup, e.g. an ELMO Harmonica Controller in case of the "CanDriveHarmonica".

entries.name: cob_generic_can
entries.description: The package cob_generic_can provides an interface for nodes on a can-bus and examplary wrappers for two PeakSys-can-libs. When a can-bus-device is generated (for an example see base_dirve_chain) you can use generic_can to create as many itfs as there will be components communicating via this can-bus. Assign type of the can communication device (e.g. usb-to-can or can-card of a specific vendor) and can-address of the target device. This package comes with wrappers for PeakSys and PeakSysUSB adapters.

entries.name: cob_undercarriage_ctrl
entries.description: cob_undercarriage_ctrl implements a controller for the omnidirectional base of Care-O-bot 3 on joint level. For a given Pltf-Twist the according wheel steering angles and linear wheel velocities are calculated based on the principle of rigid body motion. Each joint is than controlled individually to achieve the computed position and velocity

entries.name: cob_utilities
entries.description:
Deprecated
    "cob_utilities" subsumes a number of classes, which are used in the original COb3 software. E.g. "IniFile.h" supports the original inifile structure of Care-O-bot 3. "MathSup.h" provides some basic functions like conversion from degree to radion or norming of angles within +/- PI. The package is currently used while the drivers are ported to ROS and Orocos respectively. Midterm it shall be removed and the ROS structures shall be used for reading parameters during initialization. So, don't use this package in new code!

entries.name: concert_service_gazebo
entries.description: Sets up the gazebo robot manager as a service to assist in spawning/killing robots as concert clients.
entries.readme: Concert Framework Gazebo short short version) code robot-agnostic. code package [GazeboRobotManager Module](src/concert_service_gazebo/gazebo_robot_manager.py) GazeboRobotManager Creates concert clients robot Flips information robot's concert client, pretend real robot. lot code depends robot simulate. robot, implement module specific robot. abstract module detailing API [RobotManager](src/concert_service_gazebo/robot_manager.py) RobotManager Specifies spawn robot Gazebo Specifies delete robot Gazebo Specifies information flipped teleop, cmd_vel sufficient. full navigation, supply tf,map,sensory information odometry Specifies concert client simulated robots created. concert solution subsequent concert clients started /use_sim_time set true. robots simulated single master, tree tobe properly namespaced robot. applications run spawned concert clients namespaced tree. Robot configuration Parameter parameter](https://github.com/robotics-in-concert/concert_services/blob/gazebo_upgrade/concert_service_gazebo/services/gazebo_robot_world/gazebo_robot_world.parameters) robots: guimul type: kobuki robot_rapp_whitelist: [rocon_apps, concert_service_gazebo] location: gamza type: turtlebot robot_rapp_whitelist: [rocon_apps, concert_service_gazebo] location: doldol type: segbot robot_rapp_whitelist: [rocon_apps, concert_service_gazebo] location: types: kobuki launch: concert_service_gazebo/kobuki.launch flip_rule: pub: odom mobile_base/.* turtlebot launch: concert_service_gazebo/turtlebot.launch flip_rule: pub: odom camera/.* cmd_vel_mux/.* segbot launch: concert_service_gazebo/segbot.launch flip_rule: pub: odom scan_filtered cmd_vel world_file: concert_service_gazebo/empty_world.world [gazebo_solution](https://github.com/robotics-in-concert/rocon_demos/tree/gazebo_concert/gazebo_solution) demo. Install Rocon: wstool init https://raw.githubusercontent.com/robotics-in-concert/rocon_demos/gazebo_concert/gazebo_solution.rosinstall Run demo: roslaunch gazebo_solution concert.launch --screen rocon_remocon Teleop.. roslaunch office_sim_solution concert.launch --screen rocon_remocon Teleop..

entries.name: concert_service_gazebo
entries.description: Sets up the gazebo robot manager as a service to assist in spawning/killing robots as concert clients.
entries.readme: Concert Framework Gazebo short short version) code robot-agnostic. code package [GazeboRobotManager Module](src/concert_service_gazebo/gazebo_robot_manager.py) GazeboRobotManager Creates concert clients robot Flips information robot's concert client, pretend real robot. lot code depends robot simulate. robot, implement module specific robot. abstract module detailing API [RobotManager](src/concert_service_gazebo/robot_manager.py) RobotManager Specifies spawn robot Gazebo Specifies delete robot Gazebo Specifies information flipped teleop, cmd_vel sufficient. full navigation, supply tf,map,sensory information odometry Specifies concert client simulated robots created. concert solution subsequent concert clients started /use_sim_time set true. robots simulated single master, tree tobe properly namespaced robot. applications run spawned concert clients namespaced tree. [segbot_gazebo_concert](https://github.com/utexas-bwi/segbot_rocon/tree/master/segbot_gazebo_concert) demo. Install UTexas code: sudo apt-get install ros-hydro-segbot* ros-hydro-bwi* Install UTexas Rocon code rosinstall entry: git: {local-name: segbot_rocon, uri: 'https://github.com/utexas-bwi/segbot_rocon.git'} Run demo: rocon_launch segbot_gazebo_concert gazebo.concert --screen implementation RobotManager Segbot [concert_service_segbot_gazebo](https://github.com/utexas-bwi/segbot_rocon/tree/master/concert_service_segbot_gazebo) repository.

entries.name: ecl_containers
entries.description:
The containers included here are intended to extend the stl containers.
    In all cases, these implementations are designed to implement
    c++ conveniences and safety where speed is not sacrificed. 

    Also includes techniques for memory debugging of common problems such
    as buffer overruns.

entries.name: ecl_converters
entries.description:
Some fast/convenient type converters, mostly for char strings or strings.
     These are not really fully fleshed out, alot of them could use the addition for
     the whole range of fundamental types (e.g. all integers, not just int, unsigned int).
     
     They will come as the need arises.

entries.name: ecl_ipc
entries.description:
Interprocess mechanisms vary greatly across platforms - sysv, posix, win32, there
  are more than a few. This package provides an infrastructure to allow for developing 
  cross platform c++ wrappers around the lower level c api's that handle these 
  mechanisms. These make it not only easier to utilise such mechanisms, but allow it 
  to be done consistently across platforms.

entries.name: ecl_sigslots
entries.description:
Provides a signal/slot mechanism (in the same vein as qt sigslots, 
     boost::signals etc for intra-process communication. These include 
     some improvements - they do not need a preprocessor, are fully type safe,
     allow for simple connections via a posix style string identifier 
     and are multithread-safe.

entries.name: ecl_time
entries.description:
Timing utilities are very dependent on the system api provided for their use.
	This package provides a means for handling different timing models. Current support
	
	- posix rt : complete.
	- macosx : posix timers only, missing absolute timers.
	- win : none.

entries.name: smach
entries.description:
SMACH is a task-level architecture for rapidly creating complex robot
    behavior. At its core, SMACH is a ROS-independent Python library to build
    hierarchical state machines. SMACH is a new library that takes advantage of
    very old concepts in order to quickly create robust robot behavior with
    maintainable and modular code.

entries.name: tf2
entries.description:
tf2 is the second generation of the transform library, which lets
    the user keep track of multiple coordinate frames over time. tf2
    maintains the relationship between coordinate frames in a tree
    structure buffered in time, and lets the user transform points,
    vectors, etc between any two coordinate frames at any desired
    point in time.
entries.authors: Tully Foote Eitan Marder-Eppstein Wim Meeussen

entries.name: image_transport_plugins
entries.description:
A set of plugins for publishing and subscribing to sensor_msgs/Image topics
    in representations other than raw pixel data. For example, for viewing a
    stream of images off-robot, a video codec will give much lower bandwidth
    and latency. For low frame rate tranport of high-definition images, you
    might prefer sending them as JPEG or PNG-compressed form.

entries.name: kobuki_safety_controller
entries.description:
A controller ensuring the safe operation of Kobuki.

    The SafetyController keeps track of bumper, cliff and wheel drop events. In case of the first two,
    Kobuki is commanded to move back. In the latter case, Kobuki is stopped.
    
    This controller can be enabled/disabled.
    The safety states (bumper pressed etc.) can be reset. WARNING: Dangerous!

    The SafetyController keeps track of bumper, cliff and wheel drop events. In case of the first two,
    Kobuki is commanded to move back. In the latter case, Kobuki is stopped.
    
    This controller can be enabled/disabled.
    The safety states (bumper pressed etc.) can be reset. WARNING: Dangerous!

    This controller can be enabled/disabled.
    The safety states (bumper pressed etc.) can be reset. WARNING: Dangerous!

    sensor_msgs/LaserScan into a point cloud as defined by sensor_msgs/PointCloud

    for the skew resulting from moving robots or tilting laser scanners.

entries.name: libnabo
entries.description: libnabo is a fast K Nearest Neighbour library for low-dimensional spaces.
entries.readme: libnabo fast Nearest Neighbour library low-dimensional spaces. clean, legacy-free, scalar-type–agnostic API templates. current CPU implementation strongly inspired [ANN], compact data types. average, libnabo faster [ANN]. libnabo depends [Eigen], modern matrix linear-algebra library. libnabo works version Eigen. libnabo depends [Boost], general library. libnabo developed [Stéphane Magnenat](http://stephane.magnenat.net) part work [ASL-ETH](http://www.asl.ethz.ch) maintained [Simon Lynen](http://www.asl.ethz.ch/people/slynen). Download Ubuntu builds PPA https://launchpad.net/~stephane.magnenat provide package shared library, development headers documentation. source code github, clone git tree git clone git://github.com/ethz-asl/libnabo.git checkout specific branch, instance checkout version libnabo git checkout Compilation libnabo [CMake] build system. complete compilation process depends system (Linux, Mac Windows). find nice introductory tutorial video](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CLvZTyji_Uw). Prerequisites operating system provide [Eigen] [Boost]. [Eigen] downloaded extracted. `grep`, standard Linux Mac window version [here](http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/grep.htm). Compilation options libnabo compilation options, [CMake]: `SHARED_LIBS` (boolean, default: `false`): `true`, build shared library, build static library command-line tool, `ccmake`, graphical tool, `cmake-gui`. read [CMake documentation] information. Quick compilation installation Unix Unix, assuming [Eigen] [Boost] installed system-wide, compile optimisation debug information) install libnabo `/usr/local` commands run top-level directory libnabo's sources: SRC_DIR=`pwd` BUILD_DIR=${SRC_DIR}/build mkdir ${BUILD_DIR} ${BUILD_DIR} cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo ${SRC_DIR} Eigen Boost system-wide, run point: cmake-gui cmake-gui location Eigen Boost sudo install lines compile libnabo `build` sub-directory source tree clean. Note compile libnabo write access, `/tmp/libnabo`. out-of-source build nice feature [CMake]. [Eigen] [Boost] installed system-wide, [CMake] find `ccmake` `cmake-gui`). generate documentation typing: doc Usage libnabo easy assuming working floats point set query point find nearest neighbours #include "nabo/nabo.h" namespace Nabo; namespace Eigen; NNSearchF* nns NNSearchF::createKDTreeLinearHeap(M); const int VectorXi indices(K); VectorXf dists2(K); nns->knn(q, indices, dists2, [Eigen] (refering software, math) matrix (column major, float) [Eigen] vector (float). results `indices` `dists2` [Eigen] vectors indices squared distances refering columns `examples/trivial.cpp` compilable version `examples/usage.cpp` slightly complex involving multi-point queries. Running doc` build directory generate browsable documentation `doc/html`. main page `doc/html/index.html` detailed overview usage libnabo. Python bindings libnabo includes python bindings compiled python resulting module called pynabo, `python/test.py`. find information docstring-based documentation: python "import pynabo; help(pynabo.NearestNeighbourSearch)" Unit testing distribution libnabo integrates unit test module, based CTest. type: test build directory run tests. outputs `Testing` directory. consist validation benchmarking tests. [ANN] [FLANN] detected compiling libnabo, test` perform comparative benchmarks. Citing libnabo libnabo academic context, cite paper evaluates performances contex ICP: @article{elsebergcomparison, title={Comparison nearest-neighbor-search strategies implementations efficient shape registration}, author={Elseberg, Magnenat, Siegwart, N{\"u}chter, journal={Journal Software Engineering Robotics (JOSER)}, pages={2--12}, volume={3}, number={1}, year={2012}, issn={2035-3928} Bug reporting [github's issue tracker](http://github.com/ethz-asl/libnabo/issues) report bugs. License libnabo released permissive BSD license. [ANN]: http://www.cs.umd.edu/~mount/ANN [FLANN]: http://www.cs.ubc.ca/~mariusm/index.php/FLANN/FLANN [CMake]: http://www.cmake.org [CMake documentation]: http://www.cmake.org/cmake/help/cmake2.6docs.html [Eigen]: http://eigen.tuxfamily.org [Boost]: http://www.boost.org

entries.name: libpointmatcher
entries.description: libpointmatcher is a modular ICP library, useful for robotics and computer vision.
entries.readme: Documentation Tutorials libpointmatcher modular ICP library, robotics computer vision. **Quick link tutorial pages: [Tutorials](doc/Tutorials.md tutorials written Markdown syntax stored project's `/doc` folder. scope ranges introductory material performing point cloud registration instructions experienced developer extend library's codebase. Libpointmatcher's source code fully documented based doxygen provide easy API developers. API [here](http://docs.ros.org/groovy/api/libpointmatcher/html/), suggested build version `doc/html`. libpointmatcher depends [Eigen] version modern matrix linear-algebra library, [libnabo] version fast Nearest Neighbour library low-dimensional spaces. [Doxygen], documentation-generation tool [yaml-cpp], YAML parser emitter (optional) compiled [Ubuntu](/doc/Compilation.md) [Windows](/doc/CompilationWindows.md) [Mac X](/doc/CompilationMac.md) libpointmatcher developed [François Pomerleau](mailto:f.pomerleau@gmail.com) [Stéphane Magnenat](http://stephane.magnenat.net) part work [ASL-ETH](http://www.asl.ethz.ch). read latest [release notes](doc/ReleaseNotes.md). Pre-built binaries Ubuntu Binaries Ubuntu Linux PPA: [Lucid](https://launchpad.net/~stephane.magnenat/+archive/lucid) [Precise](https://launchpad.net/~stephane.magnenat/+archive/precise) [Quantal](https://launchpad.net/~stephane.magnenat/+archive/quantal) [Raring](https://launchpad.net/~stephane.magnenat/+archive/raring) added PPA system, install libpointmatcher sudo apt-get install libpointmatcher-dev built binaries systems, Prerequisites operating system provide [Eigen]. downloaded extracted. [libnabo] downloaded installed, follow [libnabo]'s documentation Compilation Installation beginner users familiar compiling installing library Linux, [here](doc/Compilation.md) detailed instructions compile libpointmatcher source code. comfortable Linux CMake installed prerequisites commands install libpointmatcher system. mkdir build build cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo sudo install Testing Libpointmatcher ships version Google testing framework [GTest](https://code.google.com/p/googletest/). Unit tests located utest/ compiled libpointmatcher. run tests compiled version working correctly, run test executable build directory: build utest/utest --path ../examples/data/ Bug reporting [github's issue tracker](http://github.com/ethz-asl/libpointmatcher/issues) report bugs. Citing libpointmatcher academic context, cite publication: @article{Pomerleau12comp, author {Pomerleau, Fran{\c c}ois Colas, Francis Siegwart, Roland Magnenat, St{\'e}phane}, title {{Comparing ICP Variants Real-World Data Sets}}, journal {Autonomous Robots}, year volume number pages month feb and/or @INPROCEEDINGS{pomerleau11tracking, author {Fran{\c c}ois Pomerleau St{\'e}phane Magnenat Francis Colas Ming Liu Roland Siegwart}, title {Tracking Depth Camera: Parameter Exploration Fast ICP}, booktitle {Proc. IEEE/RSJ International Conference Intelligent Robots Systems (IROS)}, publisher {IEEE Press}, pages year Projects Partners libpointmatcher project listed contact [François Pomerleau](mailto:f.pomerleau@gmail.com) [Stéphane Magnenat](http://stephane.magnenat.net). European Project [NIFTi](http://www.nifti.eu/) ICT-247870): Search rescue project dynamic environments. Results: [video multi-floor reconstruction](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lP5Mj-TGaiw) [video railyard reconstruction](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ygIvzWVfPYk). results real-time computation. NASA Ames [Stereo Pipeline](http://ti.arc.nasa.gov/tech/asr/intelligent-robotics/ngt/stereo/): Planetary reconstruction satellite observations. Results: Mars, Moon Earth point clouds. Armasuisse UGV research program [ARTOR](http://www.artor.ethz.ch/): Development techniques reliable autonomous navigation wheeled robot rough, outdoor terrain. Results: [video urban dynamic reconstruction](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UCCAUf64tD0) [video open space reconstruction](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M5Y99o7um88) real-time computation. Swiss National Science Foundation [Limnobotics](http://www.limnobotics.ch/): Robotic solution toxic algae monitoring lacs. Result: [video shore reconstruction](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g8l-Xq4qYeE) real-time computation. larger list work realized libpointmatcher, page [Applications Publications](/doc/ApplicationsAndPub.md). License libpointmatcher released permissive BSD license. [Ubuntu]: http://www.ubuntu.com [CMake]: http://www.cmake.org [CMake documentation]: http://www.cmake.org/cmake/help/cmake2.6docs.html [git]: http://git-scm.com [Eigen]: http://eigen.tuxfamily.org [libnabo]: http://github.com/ethz-asl/libnabo [ROS]: http://www.ros.org/ [Paraview]: http://www.paraview.org/ [yaml-cpp]: http://code.google.com/p/yaml-cpp/ [Doxygen]: http://www.stack.nl/~dimitri/doxygen/

entries.name: libmavconn
entries.description:
MAVLink communication library.
    This library provide unified connection handling classes
    and URL to connection object mapper.

    This library can be used in standalone programs.
entries.readme: MAVCONN library mavlink connection communication library [MAVROS][mr]. adopted ROS environment splitting individual package removing dependencies rosconsole. Connection URL Connection defined URL. pass URL `MAVConnInterface::open_url()` connection object. Supported schemas: Serial: `/path/to/serial/device[:baudrate]` Serial: `serial:///path/to/serial/device[:baudrate][?ids=sysid,compid]` UDP: `udp://[bind_host[:port]]@[remote_host[:port]][/?ids=sysid,compid]` TCP client: `tcp://[server_host][:port][/?ids=sysid,compid]` TCP server: `tcp-l://[bind_port][:port][/?ids=sysid,compid]` Note: ids URL overrides ids system\_id component\_id parameters. Dependencies mavros: Linux host Boost Boost.ASIO Boost.Signals2) console-bridge library compiller support License Licensed terms LGPLv3 GPLv3 GPLv3 headers, LGPL). https://github.com/mavlink/mavros

entries.name: mavros
entries.description:
MAVROS -- MAVLink extendable communication node for ROS
    with UDP proxy for Ground Control Station.
entries.readme: MAVROS MAVLink extendable communication node ROS proxy Ground Control Station [QGroundControl][qgc]). ROS API documentation moved [wiki.ros.org][wiki]. Features Communication autopilot serial port, UDP TCP [ArduPilot][apm]) Internal proxy Ground Control Station (serial, UDP, TCP) [mavlink\_ros][mlros] compatible ROS topics (Mavlink.msg) Plugin system ROS-MAVLink translation Parameter manipulation tool Waypoint manipulation tool PX4Flow support [mavros\_extras][mrext]) Limitations linux. Depends [Boost library][boost] (hydro Catkin build system required (tested ROS Hydro Medusa Indigo Igloo). package dependent [ros-\*-mavlink][mlwiki] build [mavlink-gbp-release][mlgbp]. exists hydro indigo package index install rosdep). Connection URL Connection defined URL, supported type FCU GCS. Supported schemas: Serial: `/path/to/serial/device[:baudrate]` Serial: `serial:///path/to/serial/device[:baudrate][?ids=sysid,compid]` UDP: `udp://[bind_host[:port]]@[remote_host[:port]][/?ids=sysid,compid]` TCP client: `tcp://[server_host][:port][/?ids=sysid,compid]` TCP server: `tcp-l://[bind_port][:port][/?ids=sysid,compid]` Note: ids URL overrides ids system\_id component\_id parameters. Programs mavros\_node main communication node Main node. disable GCS proxy setting empty URL. Run rosrun mavros mavros_node _fcu_url:=/dev/ttyACM0:115200 _gcs_url:=tcp-l:// gcs\_bridge additional UDP proxy add channel GCS. connect GCS HIL tablet. Previous `ros_udp`. (HIL DroidPlanner): rosrun mavros mavros_node _gcs_url:='udp://:14556@hil-host:14551' rosrun mavros gcs_bridge _gcs_url:='udp://@nexus7' mavparam parameter manipulation Examples: rosrun mavros mavparam dump /tmp/apm.param rosrun mavros mavparam load /tmp/apm2.param mavwp mission manipulation Examples: rosrun mavros mavwp show rosrun mavros dump /tmp/mission.txt mavsafety safety tool Examples: rosrun mavros mavsafety arm rosrun mavros mavsafety disarm mavcmd commander tool Examples: rosrun mavros mavcmd takeoff rosrun mavros mavcmd sethome --current-gps Installation `wstool` utility installation. workspace wstool init src initialized) wstool set src mavros --git https://github.com/mavlink/mavros.git wstool update src rosdep install --from-paths src --ignore-src --rosdistro hydro regular `catkin_make` build install. Notes: [#35][iss35]) mavlink submodule moved special ROS party package [ros-\*-mavlink][mlwiki]. *Important*. current implementation mavlink select dialect run-time, mavros package plugin packages) compile-time option `MAVLINK_DIALECT`, default 'aurdupilotmega'. change dialect Add cmake definition catkin: `catkin_make -DMAVLINK_DIALECT=pixhawk` Edit configuration `catkin_make edit_cache` `cmake-gui build`, creates drop-down list dialects `catkin_make edit_cache`. Ubuntu: `sudo apt-get install cmake-qt-gui` Installing ros-\*-mavlink source rosdep install mavlink library, install source: mkdir ~/ros_deps/src ~/ros_deps rosinstall_generator mavlink tee rosinstall.yaml wstool init src ./rosinstall.yaml catkin_make_isolated --install-space $ROSINSTALL --install -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release $ROSINSTALL writable user add `sudo command. build debian package pulling bloom branch [mavlink-gbp-release][mlgbp] (common naming: `debian/<rosdistro>/<osdistro>/<package>`) binary`. Links [MAVLink][ml] communication protocol [mavlink\_ros][mlros] original ROS node messages, proxy) [ArduPilot][apm] tested autopilot APM:Plane (default command set) [QGroundControl][qgc] tested ground control station linux [DroidPlanner][dp] tested GCS Android [mavros\_extras][mrext] extra plugins node mavros [qgc]: http://qgroundcontrol.org/ [apm]: http://ardupilot.com/ [mlros]: https://github.com/mavlink/mavlink_ros [boost]: http://www.boost.org/ http://mavlink.org/mavlink/start https://github.com/arthurbenemann/droidplanner/ [mlgbp]: https://github.com/mavlink/mavlink-gbp-release [iss35]: https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/issues/35 [wiki]: http://wiki.ros.org/mavros [mrext]: https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/tree/master/mavros_extras [mlwiki]: http://wiki.ros.org/mavlink

entries.name: mongodb_store
entries.description: A package to support MongoDB-based storage and analysis for data from a ROS system, eg. saved messages, configurations etc
entries.readme: mongodb_store package wraps MongoDB database server ROS, allowing store configuration parameters. nodes mongodb_server.py config_manager.py node depends MongoDB Python client libraries Install sudo apt-get install python-pymongo mongodb give required version, sudo pip install pymongo Running mongodb_server start datacentre: rosparam set mongodb_port rosparam set mongodb_host bob note multiple machines, 'localhost' good rosrun mongodb_store mongodb_server.py default, mongod database stored `/opt/strands/mongodb_store`. overridden setting private parameter ~database_path node. time database run ```mkdir /opt/strands/mongodb_store prefer mongodb instance, set mongodb_* parameters Config Manager Overview config manager centralised store robot application parameters, optional site-specific overrides. configurations stored mongodb_store mongodb, database named "configs". levels parameters considered: Global default parameters. "working defaults" essential parameters default robot application requires calibration data default values Default parameters shared sites stored shared ROS package. config manager started, .yaml files stored 'defaults' folder examined. default parameters automatically inserted "defaults" collection configs database. defaults folder supplied private parameter: `~defaults_path` set system path form `pkg://ros_package_name/inside/package`. Local parameters. parameters override named global default parameters, allowing site-specific parameter setting. stored database "local" collection. start config manager places parameters ros parameter server interoperability existing software. Parameters queried /config_manager/get_param service, connection querying mongo database server. local parameter overrides set /config_manager/set_param service editing "local" collection configs database. Running config manager start config manager, mongo running rosrun mongodb_store config_manager.py _defaults_path:=pkg://my_package/defaults load parameters ros parameter server, checked rosparam list Reading parameters methods access parameter values: copy ros parameter server: rosparam /my/parameter rospy roscpp libraries. config_manager service: rosservice call /config_manager/get_param "param_name: '/my/parameter'" database server Setting parameters Default parameters set placing yaml files defaults directory mongodb_store. default parameters added github repo shared users. local parameter overrides set ways: config_manager service: rosservice call /config_manager/set_param "param: '{\"path\":\"/chris\",\"value\":43}'" Note syntax parameter: json representation dictionary path keys. config_manager service: rosservice call /config_manager/save_param name_of_the_parameter_to_be_saved Note: save current parameter locals database database server Launch files mongodb config_manager started datacentre.launch file: HOSTNAME=yourhost roslaunch mongodb_store datacentre.launch db_path:=/path/to/db db_port:=62345 HOSTNAME env variable required; db_path default /opt/strands/mongodb_store db_port default Replication constructor arcgument message store node `replicate_on_write` set true, replication message store parts datacentre manually content hosts. list hosts ports replications set `mongodb_store_extras` parameter: ```yaml mongodb_store_extras: [["localhost", ["localhost", Inserts updates performed acorss main replicant datacentres. `mongodb_store_extras` set `replicate_on_write`), queries performed main replicants launch additional datacentres ```bash rosrun mongodb_store mongodb_server.py _master:=false _database_path:=/opt/strands/strands_mongodb_62344 _host:=localhost _port:=62344 rosrun mongodb_store mongodb_server.py _master:=false _database_path:=/opt/strands/strands_mongodb_62333 _host:=localhost _port:=62333 test works adding message store, deleting master RoboMongo message store deletes replicated), running queries. Action Server Replication `MoveEntries` action action server: ```bash rosrun mongodb_store replicator_node.py included `datacentre.launch`) bulk copy move entries message store collections mongod instances defined `mongodb_store_extras`. client accepts list collection names `meta["inserted_at"]` field message store entries replicate move entries inserted time. time default hours client list collections command line. *moves* entries inserted hours earlier. ```bash rosrun mongodb_store replicator_client.py message_store robblog scheduling_problems **NOTE `update` operations bit uncertain, type replication collections plan update

entries.name: moveit_python
entries.description: A pure-python interaface to the MoveIt! ROS API.
entries.readme: moveit_python set pure-python bindings ROS interface MoveIt! based earlier moveit_utils package developed part chess_player package. Overview interfaces MoveGroupInterface move arm move_group action. PlanningSceneInterface add/remove collision attached objects. set colors objects. PickPlaceInterface interface pick place actions. MoveGroupInterface MoveGroupInterface easy ```python import rospy moveit_python import rospy.init_node("moveit_py") MoveGroupInterface("planning_group_name", "base_link") values base_link, planning group called "planning_group_name". PlanningSceneInterface PlanningSceneInterface easily insert remove objects MoveIt! planning scene. moveit_commander, module tracks objects added removed, re-attempt add/remove message loss. ```python import rospy moveit_python import rospy.init_node("moveit_py") create planning scene interface, provide root link PlanningSceneInterface("base_link") add cube size, base_link frame p.addCube("my_cube", remove cube p.removeCollisionObject("my_cube") time object added removed, planning scene interface wait recieves confirmation request processed MoveIt! sending large number objects, efficient wait synchronization achieved ```python p.addCube("my_cube", wait=False) p.addCube("my_other_cube", wait=False) p.waitForSync() PickPlaceInterface ```python import rospy moveit_python import moveit_msgs.msg import Grasp, PlaceLocation rospy.init_node("moveit_py") provide arm group gripper group names takes parameter "plan_only" defaults False PickPlaceInterface("arm", "gripper") Grasp() fill setup object named object_name PlanningSceneInterface p.pickup("object_name", support_name "supporting_surface") PlaceLocation() fill p.place("object_name" goal_is_eef True, support_name "supporting_surface") Migration moveit_utils GraspingInterface renamed PickPlaceInterface pick/place functions return entire action result, moveit_utils returned error_code. access error code returned, result.error_code.val ObjectManager renamed PlanningSceneInterface remove function removeCollisionObject removeAttachedObject ArmInterface renamed MoveGroupInterface

entries.name: moveit_simple_grasps
entries.description:
A basic grasp generator for simple objects such as blocks or cylinders for use with the MoveIt! pick and place pipeline. 
    Does not consider friction cones or other dynamics.
entries.readme: MoveIt! Simple Grasps basic grasp generator simple objects blocks cylinders MoveIt! pick place pipeline. friction cones dynamics. current implementation simple takes input pose vector (postition orientation) generates large number potential grasp approaches directions. includes grasp filter removing kinematically infeasible grasps threaded solvers. package includes: Simple pose-based grasp generator block Separate grasp generators custom objects rectanguar cylindrical objects Grasp filter Test code visualizations Developed [Dave Coleman](http://dav.ee) Correll Robotics Lab, University Colorado Boulder contributors. ``. Code Usage Note: find moveit_blocks.h discussed bottom page, helpful. discuss generation, filtering, visualization components. robot's ROS package, add package package.xml, CMakeLists.txt. file add includes: Grasp generation visualization #include #include #include Add class's member variables Grasp generator moveit_simple_grasps::SimpleGraspsPtr simple_grasps_; class publishing stuff rviz moveit_visual_tools::MoveItVisualToolsPtr visual_tools_; robot-specific data generating grasps moveit_simple_grasps::GraspData grasp_data_; class' constructor initialize visualization tools; Load Robot Tools publishing Rviz visual_tools_.reset(new moveit_visual_tools::MoveItVisualTools("base_link")); Change parameter visual tools robot's base link. information package, [moveit_visual_tools](https://github.com/davetcoleman/moveit_visual_tools). load robot's custom .yaml grasp data file: Load grasp data specific robot ros::NodeHandle (!grasp_data_.loadRobotGraspData(nh, "left_hand")) ros::shutdown(); entries.name: moveit_simple_grasps
entries.description:
A basic grasp generator for simple objects such as blocks or cylinders for use with the MoveIt! pick and place pipeline. 
    Does not consider friction cones or other dynamics.
entries.readme: MoveIt! Simple Grasps basic grasp generator simple objects blocks cylinders MoveIt! pick place pipeline. friction cones dynamics. current implementation simple takes input pose vector (postition orientation) generates large number potential grasp approaches directions. includes grasp filter removing kinematically infeasible grasps threaded solvers. package includes: Simple pose-based grasp generator block Separate grasp generators custom objects rectanguar cylindrical objects Grasp filter Test code visualizations Developed [Dave Coleman](http://dav.ee) Correll Robotics Lab, University Colorado Boulder contributors. ``. entries.name: mrpt_localization
entries.description:
This package provides an interface for the mprt (Mobile robotics C++ libraries) 
  and enables the included node to solve a 2D self-localization problem given an existing map.
  The node is able to use mrpt map formats as well as published ros maps. 
  The interface is similar to the amcl (http://wiki.ros.org/amcl) pkg.

entries.name: master_discovery_fkie
entries.description:
Discover the running ROS Masters in local network. The 
     discovering is done by sending an echo heartbeat messages to a defined 
     multicast group.
     The alternative is to use a zeroconf/avahi daemon to register the ROS 
     master as service and discover other ROS masters.

entries.name: amcl
base_local_planner
entries.description: This package provides implementations of the Trajectory Rollout and Dynamic Window approaches to local robot navigation on a plane. Given a plan to follow and a costmap, the controller produces velocity commands to send to a mobile base. This package supports both holonomic and non-holonomic robots, any robot footprint that can be represented as a convex polygon or circle, and exposes its configuration as ROS parameters that can be set in a launch file. This package's ROS wrapper adheres to the BaseLocalPlanner interface specified in the

entries.name: carrot_planner
entries.description: This planner attempts to find a legal place to put a carrot for the robot to follow. It does this by moving back along the vector between the robot and the goal point.

entries.name: clear_costmap_recovery
entries.description: This package provides a recovery behavior for the navigation stack that attempts to clear space by reverting the costmaps used by the navigation stack to the static map outside of a given area.

entries.name: costmap_2d
entries.description:
This package provides an implementation of a 2D costmap that takes in sensor
        data from the world, builds a 2D or 3D occupancy grid of the data (depending
        on whether a voxel based implementation is used), and inflates costs in a
        2D costmap based on the occupancy grid and a user specified inflation radius.
        This package also provides support for map_server based initialization of a
        costmap, rolling window based costmaps, and parameter based subscription to
        and configuration of sensor topics.
entries.authors: Eitan Marder-Eppstein David V. Lu!! Dave Hershberger contradict@gmail.com

entries.name: dwa_local_planner
entries.description:
This package provides an implementation of the Dynamic Window Approach to
        local robot navigation on a plane. Given a global plan to follow and a
        costmap, the local planner produces velocity commands to send to a mobile
        base. This package supports any robot who's footprint can be represented as
        a convex polygon or cicrle, and exposes its configuration as ROS parameters
        that can be set in a launch file. The parameters for this planner are also
        dynamically reconfigurable. This package's ROS wrapper adheres to the
        BaseLocalPlanner interface specified in the
