entries.name: nav_core
entries.description: This package provides common interfaces for navigation specific robot actions. Currently, this package provides the BaseGlobalPlanner, BaseLocalPlanner, and RecoveryBehavior interfaces, which can be used to build actions that can easily swap their planner, local controller, or recovery behavior for new versions adhering to the same interface.

entries.name: navfn
entries.description:
navfn provides a fast interpolated navigation function that can be used to create plans for
        a mobile base. The planner assumes a circular robot and operates on a costmap to find a
        minimum cost plan from a start point to an end point in a grid. The navigation function is
        computed with Dijkstra's algorithm, but support for an A* heuristic may also be added in the
        near future. navfn also provides a ROS wrapper for the navfn planner that adheres to the
        nav_core::BaseGlobalPlanner interface specified in

entries.name: navigation
entries.description:
A 2D navigation stack that takes in information from odometry, sensor
        streams, and a goal pose and outputs safe velocity commands that are sent
        to a mobile base.

entries.name: robot_pose_ekf
entries.description: The Robot Pose EKF package is used to estimate the 3D pose of a robot, based on (partial) pose measurements coming from different sources. It uses an extended Kalman filter with a 6D model (3D position and 3D orientation) to combine measurements from wheel odometry, IMU sensor and visual odometry. The basic idea is to offer loosely coupled integration with different sensors, where sensor signals are received as ROS messages.

entries.name: rotate_recovery
entries.description: This package provides a recovery behavior for the navigation stack that attempts to clear space by performing a 360 degree rotation of the robot.

entries.name: voxel_grid
entries.description: voxel_grid provides an implementation of an efficient 3D voxel grid. The occupancy grid can support 3 different representations for the state of a cell: marked, free, or unknown. Due to the underlying implementation relying on bitwise and and or integer operations, the voxel grid only supports 16 different levels per voxel column. However, this limitation yields raytracing and cell marking performance in the grid comparable to standard 2D structures making it quite fast compared to most 3D structures.

entries.name: nav2d_navigator
entries.description:
This package provides a node for higher level navigation of a mobile
    robot in a planar environment. It needs a map and the robot's position
    within this map to create a plan for navigation. When used together with
    a SLAM module it can also be used to perform autonomous exploration of
    the robot's workspace.

entries.name: nav2d_navigator
entries.description:
This package provides a node for higher level navigation of a mobile
    robot in a planar environment. It needs a map and the robot's position
    within this map to create a plan for navigation. When used together with
    a SLAM module it can also be used to perform autonomous exploration of
    the robot's workspace.

entries.name: nav2d_operator
entries.description:
The operator is a lightweight, purely reactive obstacle-avoidance
    module for mobile robots moving in a planar environment. The operator node
    works by evaluating a set of predefined motion primitives based on a local
    costmap and a desired direction. The best evaluated motion command will be
    send to the mobile base.

entries.name: nav2d_remote
entries.description:
This package is used to manually control a robot that uses the operator and
    navigator node from navigation_2d. Currently there is one node to control one
    robot with a joystick and one to control multiple robots in simulation.
    It can send commands directly to the operator or start and stop navigator actions.

entries.name: nodelet
entries.description:
The nodelet package is designed to provide a way to run multiple
    algorithms in the same process with zero copy transport between
    algorithms.

    This package provides both the nodelet base class needed for
    implementing a nodelet, as well as the NodeletLoader class used
    for instantiating nodelets.

entries.name: ntpd_driver
entries.description: ntpd_driver sends TimeReference message time to ntpd server
entries.readme: ntpd\_driver ROS node listen `sensor_msgs/TimeReference` send ntpd SHM gpsd). Parameter `~/shm_unit` define SHM unit ntp.conf) (int, default: Subscribe topic `~/time_ref`. System configuration ntpd configuration Add `/etc/ntp.conf`: GPS SHM driver server minpoll maxpoll fudge time1 stratum refid ROS restart ntp service. Run rosrun ntpd_driver shm_driver _shm_unit:=2 /ntpd_shm/time_ref:=/mavros/time_reference chrony configuration Add `/etc/chrony/chrony.conf`: SHM driver refclock SHM delay refid ROS stratum restart chrony service. Run rosrun ntpd_driver shm_driver _shm_unit:=0 /ntpd_shm/time_ref:=/mavros/time_reference

entries.name: ompl_visual_tools
entries.description: Rviz 3-D visualizer for planning algorithms implemented with the Open Motion Planning Library (OMPL)
entries.readme: OMPL Visual Tools OMPL Visual Tools library visualizing debugging [Open Motion Planning Library](http://ompl.kavrakilab.org/) algorithms Rviz. Formally named ompl_rviz_viewer August project spun internship Willow Garage. [Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RcGvi4Svd4k) ompl_visual_tools originally develped testing cost-based algorithms dimensional space dimension displayed cost. space grey scale cost map image passed program. lighter (closer white) pixel image "higher cost" considered Black considered cost. Additionally, absolute obstacles defining max limit cost, threshold considered obstacle. program similar OMPL.app distributed OMPL, RViz visualization streamlined costs experience-based planning. setSpaceInformation(si_); visual_tools_->setGlobalScale(100); Clear current rviz makers visual_tools_->deleteAllMarkers(); Dimensions optional cost map test environment cost map: Cost ompl::base::CostMap2DOptimizationObjectivePtr cost_map_; cost_map_->max_cost_threshold_percent_ max_cost_threshold_percent; cost_map_->loadImage(image_path); Pass cost visualizer visual_tools_->setCostMap(cost_map_->cost_); view cost map Rviz: visual_tools_->publishCostMap(cost_map_->image_); view start goal location: visual_tools_->publishState(start, rviz_visual_tools::GREEN, rviz_visual_tools::XLARGE, "plan_start_goal"); visual_tools_->publishState(goal, rviz_visual_tools::ORANGE, rviz_visual_tools::XLARGE, "plan_start_goal"); view solution path: Interpolate solution simple_setup_->getSolutionPath().interpolate(); Show path visual_tools_->publishPath( simple_setup_->getSolutionPath(), rviz_visual_tools::GREEN, "final_solution"); planner Visualize explored space visual_tools_->publishGraph(planner_data, rviz_visual_tools::ORANGE, "tree"); Visualize sample locations visual_tools_->publishSamples(planner_data); MoveIt! Robot Planning moveit_visual_tools information tools class MoveIt!. OMPL-specific features: set state space MoveIt! chosen robot OMPL: Create state space describing robot's planning group ompl_interface::ModelBasedStateSpaceSpecification model_ss_spec(moveit_robot_model, joint_model_group); const ompl_interface::JointModelStateSpaceFactory factory; ompl_interface::ModelBasedStateSpacePtr model_state_space factory.getNewStateSpace(model_ss_spec); Setup state space model_state_space->setup(); visual_tools_->setStateSpace(model_state_space); publish paths tips robot, planned OMPL: std::vector paths; simple_setup.getAllPlannerDatas(paths); tip links setup std::vector tips; joint_model_group_->getEndEffectorTips(tips); bool show_trajectory_animated true; visual_tools_->publishRobotPath(paths[0], joint_model_group, tips, show_trajectory_animated); View Rviz Start Rviz included launch file: roslaunch ompl_visual_tools ompl_rviz.launch Demo planner standard RRT: rosrun ompl_visual_tools rrt_demo optional parameters, pass argument. options. **Note:** change algorithm manually edit code* Cost Map Usage default cost map image located resources/ folder, running algorithm. Optionally pass cost map image command line argument, shown rosrun ompl_visual_tools rrt_demo cost_map.ppm image PPM "Netpbm color image" format. convert jpg, png image format Linux simply "convert" command, shown sudo apt-get install convert convert cost_map.png cost_map.ppm general, pixel image decent space size, larger dimensions require computational resources hang computer. GIMP good editor scaling images TODO Remove PPM library depend OMPL's version Develop encouraged fork package GitHub test cost-based planning algorithms visualizer!

entries.name: python_qt_binding
entries.description:
This stack provides Python bindings for Qt.
    There are two providers: pyside and pyqt.  PySide is released under
    the LGPL.  PyQt is released under the GPL.

    Both the bindings and tools to build bindings are included from each
    available provider.  For PySide, it is called "Shiboken".  For PyQt,
    this is called "SIP".

    Also provided is adapter code to make the user's Python code
    independent of which binding provider was actually used which makes
    it very easy to switch between these.
entries.authors: Dave Hershberger Dorian Scholz Dirk Thomas

entries.name: random_numbers
entries.description:
This  library contains wrappers for generating floating point values, integers, quaternions using boost libraries.
    
  The constructor of the wrapper is guaranteed to be thread safe and initialize its random number generator to a random seed.
  Seeds are obtained using a separate and different random number generator.
entries.readme: random_numbers library wrappers generating floating point values, integers, quaternions boost libraries. Build Status master branch: [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/ros-planning/random_numbers.png?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/ros-planning/random_numbers) Features pass custom random number generator seed optional deterministic behavior debugging, testing, secondary constructor.

entries.name: razor_imu_9dof
entries.description:
razor_imu_9dof is a package that provides a ROS driver
     for the Sparkfun Razor IMU 9DOF. It also provides Arduino
     firmware that runs on the Razor board, and which must be
     installed on the Razor board for the system to work. A node
     which displays the attitude (roll, pitch and yaw) of the Razor board 
     (or any IMU) is provided for testing.
entries.authors: Tang Tiong Yew Kristof Robot Paul Bouchier Peter Bartz
entries.readme: Official ROS Documentation extensive standard ROS-style version documentation ROS wiki http://wiki.ros.org/razor_imu_9dof Install Configure ROS Package Install dependencies: sudo apt-get install python-visual Download code: ~/catkin_workspace/src git clone https://github.com/KristofRobot/razor_imu_9dof.git catkin_make Edit ``launch/razor*.launch`` correct USB port: HARDWARE OPTIONS Select hardware uncommenting line! //#define HW__VERSION_CODE SparkFun "9DOF Razor IMU" version "SEN-10125" (HMC5843 magnetometer) //#define HW__VERSION_CODE SparkFun "9DOF Razor IMU" version "SEN-10736" (HMC5883L magnetometer) //#define HW__VERSION_CODE SparkFun "9DOF Sensor Stick" version "SEN-10183" (HMC5843 magnetometer) //#define HW__VERSION_CODE SparkFun "9DOF Sensor Stick" version "SEN-10321" (HMC5843 magnetometer) #define HW__VERSION_CODE SparkFun "9DOF Sensor Stick" version "SEN-10724" (HMC5883L magnetometer) Upload Arduino sketch Sparkfun 9DOF Razor IMU board Launch Publisher visualization: roslaunch razor_imu_9dof razor-pub-and-display.launch Publisher roslaunch razor_imu_9dof razor-pub.launch visualization roslaunch razor_imu_9dof razor-display.launch Calibrate accuracy, follow tutorial calibrate sensors: http://wiki.ros.org/razor_imu_9dof copy Peter Bartz's magnetometer calibration scripts https://github.com/ptrbrtz/razor-9dof-ahrs ``magnetometer_calibration`` directory.

entries.name: realtime_tools
entries.description:
Contains a set of tools that can be used from a hard
    realtime thread, without breaking the realtime behavior.  The
    tools currently only provides the realtime publisher, which makes
    it possible to publish messages to a ROS topic from a realtime
    thread. We plan to add a basic implementation of a realtime
    buffer, to make it possible to get data from a (non-realtime)
    topic callback into the realtime loop. Once the lockfree buffer is
    created, the realtime publisher will start using it, which will
    result in major API changes for the realtime publisher (removal of
    all lock methods).

entries.name: collada_parser
entries.description:
This package contains a C++ parser for the Collada robot
    description format. The parser reads a Collada XML robot
    description, and creates a C++ URDF model. Although it is possible
    to directly use this parser when working with Collada robot
    descriptions, the preferred user API is found in the urdf package.

entries.name: resource_retriever
entries.description:
This package retrieves data from url-format files such as http://,
   ftp://, package:// file://, etc., and loads the data into memory.
   The package:// url for ros packages is translated into a local
   file:// url.  The resourse retriever was initially designed to load
   mesh files into memory, but it can be used for any type of
   data. The resource retriever is based on the the libcurl library.

   file:// url.  The resourse retriever was initially designed to load
   mesh files into memory, but it can be used for any type of
   data. The resource retriever is based on the the libcurl library.

entries.name: urdf_parser
entries.description:
This package is DEPRECATED. Please use the urdfdom dependency directly instead of this package.

    This package contains a C++ parser for the Unified Robot
    Description Format (URDF), which is an XML format for representing
    a robot model.  The parser reads a URDF XML robot description, and
    creates a C++ URDF model. Although it is possible to directly use
    this parser when working with URDF robot descriptions, the
    preferred user API is found in the urdf package.

entries.name: robot_upstart
entries.description:
The robot_upstart package provides scripts which may be used to install
    and uninstall Ubuntu Linux upstart jobs which launch groups of roslaunch files.
entries.readme: robot_upstart Clearpath Robotics presents suite scripts assist launching background ROS processes Ubuntu Linux PCs. Motivation intention standardize upstart portion traditionally included <robot>_bringup packages. Functionality includes: Install upstart job run availability network interface. Copy launch files package /etc/ros/<distro>/<job>.d/ job start, coalesce launch files (mklaunch) launch Usage install job command line, simple rosrun robot_upstart install turtlebot_bringup/launch/minimal.launch --interface wlan0 create job called turtlebot, wireless. Alternatively, manually start stop job sudo service turtlebot start sudo service turtlebot stop robots components, job glob directory launch files single roslaunch instance. rosrun robot_upstart install husky_bringup/launch/core copies launch files folder /etc/ros/hydro/husky.d. launch time, /tmp/husky.launch file created <include>s launch files folder. debugging reasons, foreground launch running start script sudo husky-start show console output, errors, result final roslaunch. Platform Maintainers maintain ROS software common platform, advantage upstart provide seamless installation process users. myplatform_bringup package, maintain directory launch files represent platform's set bootstrap ROS nodes, scripts directory, add install file calls robot_upstart, #!/bin/bash rosrun robot_upstart install myplatform_bringup/launch platform setup (udev rules, network config, user add platform software packages one-liner fully set rosrun myplatform_bringup install

    provide the building blocks common to most or all multimaster systems.

    old foreign_relay and master_sync concepts.

entries.name: redis
entries.description:
The python redis client has a minor issue - it hangs on ctrl-c.
     This is a locally patched version that we can use directly until it
     is patched upstream.

     https://github.com/robotics-in-concert/rocon_multimaster/issues/30

     Note - this package has to be named 'redis' so we can conveniently
     import as if we were using the python-redis package.

entries.name: romeo_sensors

entries.readme: README romeo_sensors ROS package enables communication cameras NAOqi. computer connects robot network locally robot REMOTE COMPUTER Run romeo_sensors romeo sensors NAO_IP order images Romeo's cameras. running nao_camera, set NAO_IP robot's catkin workspace correctly sourced, run command error: roslaunch romeo_sensors cameras.launch image_view rviz visualize image(s) publishes romeo_sensors. run rostopic list, topics returned list: /camera_depth/camera_info /camera_depth/image_raw /camera_depth/image_color ROMEO Prepare romeo_sensors order robot, compile package naoqi environment. Compiling ROS package naoqi simple, explained [here!](http://wiki.ros.org/nao/Installation/compileFromVirtualNao): Run romeo_sensors romeo_sensors compiled installed robot, simply run roslaunch romeo_sensors cameras.launch image_view rviz visualize image(s) publishes romeo_sensors. run rostopic list, topics returned list: /camera_depth/camera_info /camera_depth/image_raw /camera_depth/image_color image_view visualize image(s) publishes romeo_sensors. remote computer, run image_view view images romeo_sensors, export ROS_MASTER_URI, ROS_IP, ROS_HOSTNAME information. entries.name: mk
entries.description:
A collection of .mk include files for building ROS architectural elements.
    Most package authors should use cmake .mk, which calls CMake for the build of the package.
    The other files in this package are intended for use in exotic situations that mostly arise when importing 3rdparty code.

entries.name: topic_tools
entries.description:
Tools for directing, throttling, selecting, and otherwise messing with
    ROS topics at a meta level. None of the programs in this package actually
    know about the topics whose streams they are altering; instead, these
    tools deal with messages as generic binary blobs. This means they can be
    applied to any ROS topic.

entries.name: joint_limits_interface
entries.description: Interface for enforcing joint limits.
entries.readme: Joint Limits Interface Overview **joint_limits_interface** data structures representing joint limits, methods populating common formats URDF ROS parameter server, methods enforcing limits kinds hardware interfaces. **joint_limits_interface** controllers implement `HardwareInterface`) operates controllers updated, `write()` method equivalent) robot abstraction. Enforcing limits *overwrite* commands set controllers, operate separate raw data buffer. main elements involved setting joint limits interface: **Joint limits representation** **JointLimits** Position, velocity, acceleration, jerk effort. **SoftJointLimits** Soft position limits, [here](http://www.ros.org/wiki/pr2_controller_manager/safety_limits)). **Loading URDF** convenience methods loading joint limits information (position, velocity effort), soft joint limits information URDF. **Loading ROS params** convenience methods loading joint limits ROS parameter server (position, velocity, acceleration, jerk effort).Parameter specification MoveIt, addition parse jerk effort limits. **Joint limits interface** **effort-controlled** joints, soft-limits implementation ported. **position-controlled** joints, modified version soft limits implemented. **velocity-controlled** joints, simple saturation based acceleration velocity limits implemented. Examples refer [joint_limits_interface](https://github.com/ros-controls/ros_control/wiki/joint_limits_interface) wiki page.

Enforcing limits *overwrite* commands set controllers, operate separate raw data buffer. main elements involved setting joint limits interface: **Joint limits representation** **JointLimits** Position, velocity, acceleration, jerk effort. **SoftJointLimits** Soft position limits, [here](http://www.ros.org/wiki/pr2_controller_manager/safety_limits)). **Loading URDF** conveinece methods loading joint limits information (position, velocity effort), soft joint limits information URDF. **Loading ROS params** conveinece methods loading joint limits ROS parameter server (position, velocity, acceleration, jerk effort).Parameter specification MoveIt, addition parse jerk effort limits. **Joint limits interface** **effort-controlled** joints, soft-limits implementation ported. **position-controlled** joints, modified version soft limits implemented. **velocity-controlled** joints, simple saturation based acceleration velocity limits implemented. entries.name: transmission_interface
entries.description: Transmission Interface.
entries.readme: Transmission Interface Overview **transmission_interface** data structures representing mechanical transmissions, methods propagating position, velocity effort variables actuator joint spaces. spirit **hardware_interface** package, package wraps existing raw data current actuator position, reference joint command, consistent interface. imposing specific layout raw data, easier support arbitrary hardware drivers software control. Structure main elements involved setting transmission_interface: **Transmission** class defines abstract interface mapping position, velocity effort variables actuator joint space. Derived classes implement specific transmission types, simple reducers, differentials four-bar linkages. Note single transmission couple variables multiple actuators joints differential couples actuators joints). **TransmissionHandle** class associates Transmission instance set raw data variables operates **ActuatorData** **JointData** structures). Derived classes implement specific maps, **JointToActuatorEffortHandle** **ActuatorToJointStateHandle**. **TransmissionInterface<HandleType>** class manages set transmission handles type. Note handles type, underlying transmissions heterogeneous single **ActuatorToJointPositionInterface** set transform position variables actuator joint space arm four-bar-linkage shoulder, differential wrist, simple reducers Examples refer [transmission_interface](https://github.com/ros-controls/ros_control/wiki/transmission_interface) wiki page.

Structure main elements involved setting transmission_interface: **Transmission** class defines abstract interface mapping position, velocity effort variables actuator joint space. Derived classes implement specific transmission types, simple reducers, differentials four-bar linkages. Note single transmission couple variables multiple actuators joints differential couples actuators joints). **TransmissionHandle** class associates Transmission instance set raw data variables operates **ActuatorData** **JointData** structures). Derived classes implement specific maps, **JointToActuatorEffortHandle** **ActuatorToJointStateHandle**. **TransmissionInterface<HandleType>** class manages set transmission handles type. Note handles type, underlying transmissions heterogeneous single **ActuatorToJointPositionInterface** set transform position variables actuator joint space arm four-bar-linkage shoulder, differential wrist, simple reducers TODO Read transmission configuration configuration files. Examples refer [transmission_interface](https://github.com/ros-controls/ros_control/wiki/transmission_interface) wiki page.

entries.name: joint_trajectory_controller
entries.description: joint_trajectory_controller
entries.readme: Joint Trajectory Controller Overview features Controller executing joint-space trajectories group joints. Trajectory segment type Controller templated **segment type**. Multi-dof **quintic spline** segment implementation default. Hardware interface type Controller templated **hardware interface type**. **Position** **effort** control joint interfaces default. **Realtime-safe**. Proper handling **wrapping** (continuous) joints. **Online trajectory replacement**: commands smoothly combined executed trajectory. **Robust system clock Discontinuous system clock discontinuities execution queued trajectory segments. ROS API Commands: [control_msgs::FollowJointTrajectory](http://docs.ros.org/groovy/api/control_msgs/html/action/FollowJointTrajectory.html) action interface. [trajectory_msgs::JointTrajectory](http://docs.ros.org/api/trajectory_msgs/html/msg/JointTrajectory.html) topic interface. Support *deprecated* [pr2_controllers_msgs::JointTrajectory](http://docs.ros.org/api/pr2_controllers_msgs/html/msg/JointTrajectoryAction.html) action interface dropped. Controller state querries: Current state [control_msgs::JointTrajectoryControllerState](http://docs.ros.org/api/control_msgs/html/msg/JointTrajectoryControllerState.html) topic. State future time queried [control_msgs::QueryTrajectoryState](http://docs.ros.org/api/control_msgs/html/srv/QueryTrajectoryState.html) service. Controller configuration examples Minimal description, position interface ```yaml head_controller: type: "position_controllers/JointTrajectoryController" joints: head_1_joint head_2_joint Complete description, effort interface ```yaml head_controller: type: "effort_controllers/JointTrajectoryController" joints: head_1_joint head_2_joint constraints: goal_time: Defaults stopped_velocity_tolerance: Defaults head_1_joint: trajectory: enforced unspecified goal: enforced unspecified head_2_joint: goal: gains: Needed map position+velocity commands effort command head_1_joint: i_clamp: head_2_joint: i_clamp: state_publish_rate: Defaults action_monitor_rate: Defaults hold_trajectory_duration: Defaults

entries.name: rospy_message_converter
entries.description: Converts between Python dictionaries and JSON to rospy messages.
entries.readme: Rospy_message_converter lightweight ROS package Python library convert Python dictionaries JSON messages [rospy](http://www.ros.org/wiki/rospy) messages, vice versa. Usage Convert dictionary ROS message ```python rospy_message_converter import message_converter std_msgs.msg import String dictionary 'data': 'Howdy' message message_converter.convert_dictionary_to_ros_message('std_msgs/String', dictionary) Convert ROS message dictionary ```python rospy_message_converter import message_converter std_msgs.msg import String message String(data 'Howdy') dictionary message_converter.convert_ros_message_to_dictionary(message) Convert JSON ROS message ```python rospy_message_converter import json_message_converter std_msgs.msg import String json_str '{"data": "Hello"}' message json_message_converter.convert_json_to_ros_message('std_msgs/String', json_str) Convert ROS message JSON ```python rospy_message_converter import json_message_converter std_msgs.msg import String message String(data 'Hello') json_str json_message_converter.convert_ros_message_to_json(message) Test run tests: ```bash rostest rospy_message_converter test_all.test License Project released BSD license.

entries.name: rqt_py_common
entries.description:
rqt_py_common provides common functionality for rqt plugins written in Python.
    Despite no plugin is provided, this package is part of the rqt_common_plugins
    repository to keep refactoring generic functionality from these common plugins
    into this package as easy as possible.

    Functionality included in this package should cover generic ROS concepts and
    should not introduce any special dependencies beside "ros_base".

entries.readme: RTT Actionlib Actionlib action servers provide interfaces, actionlib action clients reciprocate: Inputs: Goal topic Cancel topic Outputs: Status topic Feedback topic Result topic goal) Orocos RTT component provide actionlib interface, provide topics order expose actionlib interfaces components running real-time threads, rtt data ports connect topics. order easy connect ports, package API constructing RTT data ports RTT service connecting ports ROS topics Contents package API RTT service constructing connecting RTT ports ROS actionlib action namespace. Providng Actions Orocos standard ROS actionlib server, subscribing publishing ROS messages actionlib topics handled automatiaclly ActionServer class, users meant delegate instance class. ActionServer calls short-running "goal" "cancel" callbacks receives messages. user-supplied callbacks goal handlesare set accepted/rejected preempted, user sets status handles calling member functions `setSucceeded()`, `setAborted()` handles. calls call parent ActionServer's `publishResult()`,`publishStatus()` member functions. "normal" ActionServer implements functions ROS publishers subscribers, RTT, data ports. implement RTTActionServer class inherits ActionServerBase implements "publish" functions RTT data ports binds goal cancel callbacks RTT event ports. Calling Actions Orocos TBD Usage RTT ports created service subservice) TaskContext. easily creted delegating RTTActionServer. RTTActionServer create RTT ports bind user-supplied callbacks. add actionlib interface compnent, similar ```cpp class SomeComponent public RTT::TaskContext private: Convenience typedefs typedef actionlib::ServerGoalHandle<some_msgs::SomeAction> GoalHandle; RTT action server rtt_actionlib::RTTActionServer<some_msgs::SomeAction> rtt_action_server_; public: Component constructor SomeComponent(std::string TaskContext(name, RTT::PreOperational) Add action server ports task's root service rtt_action_server_.addPorts(this->provides()); Bind action server goal cancel callbacks rtt_action_server_.registerGoalCallback(boost::bind(&SomeComponent::goalCallback, rtt_action_server_.registerCancelCallback(boost::bind(&SomeComponent::cancelCallback, RTT start hook bool startHook() Start action server rtt_action_server_.start(); return true; RTT update hook void updateHook() Pursue goal Called rtt_action_server_ goal received void goalCallback(GoalHandle Accept/reject goal requests Called rtt_action_server_ goal cancelled preempted void cancelCallback(GoalHandle Handle preemption ports connected ROS topics. hard-coded action topic names, "actionlib" RTT service similarly ```python Imports import("rtt_ros"); ros.import("rtt_actionlib"); Load application-specific component loadComponent("some_component_name","some_component_package::SomeComponent") Load actionlib service loadService("some_component_name","actionlib") Connect actionlib interface task's root service requires ports exist directions (server/client): some_component_name._action_goal (in/out) some_component_name._action_cancel (in/out) some_component_name._action_status (out/in) some_component_name._action_result (out/in) some_component_name._action_feedback (out/in) ports created RTTActionServer RTTActionClient. some_component_name.actionlib.connect("/some/ros/namespace/my_action") Alternatively, connect actionlib interface sub-service: some_component_name.actionlib.connectSub( "some_prov.ided_service", "/some/ros/namespace/my_other_action") Future Work Add operation actionlib service connects goal/cancel callbacks RTT operations RTT component operations types bound actionlib service Add action client support. Add "simple" mode implememnts policy SimpleActionServer

entries.name: rtt_dynamic_reconfigure
entries.description: The rtt_dynamic_reconfigure package
entries.readme: rtt_dynamic_reconfigure package manipulate properties Orocos RTT component ROS [dynamic_reconfigure](http://wiki.ros.org/dynamic_reconfigure) interface. Dynamic reconfigure combination ROS topics, services, parameter server enable quick reconfiguration parameters network. Usage automatically generated config easiest rtt_dynamic_reconfigure special `AutoConfig` config type. `AutoConfig` automatically generates dynamic_reconfigure config description set properties `TaskContext` loaded properties created. rtt_dynamic_reconfigure precompiled service plugin `AutoConfig` type. Simply add dynamic_reconfigure server component loading `reconfigure` service: ```cpp import("rtt_dynamic_reconfigure"); loadService("my_component", "reconfigure") my_component.reconfigure.advertise("/my_component") disadvantage method minimum maximum values requrired dynamic_reconfigure unknown. current values properties advertised default values. overwrite automatically choosen minimum/maximum values calling `advertise()` operation: ```cpp import("rtt_dynamic_reconfigure"); loadService("my_component", "reconfigure") my_component.reconfigure.min.int_property my_component.reconfigure.max.int_property my_component.reconfigure.advertise("~/my_component") custom config file rtt_dynamic_reconfigure package templated `rtt_dynamic_reconfigure::Server<ConfigType>` class implements core functionality dynamic_reconfigure server. `ConfigType` class header generated automatically `*.cfg` file dynamic_reconfigure's `generate_dynamic_reconfigure_options()` cmake macro. config file describes parameters minimum, maximum default values. order rtt_dynamic_reconfigure custom config, create `.cfg` file explained tutorial](http://wiki.ros.org/dynamic_reconfigure/Tutorials/HowToWriteYourFirstCfgFile). add rtt_dynamic_reconfigure service plugin package: ```cmake project(my_package) find_package(dynamic_reconfigure) generate_dynamic_reconfigure_options(cfg/MyPackage.cfg) orocos_plugin(my_package_reconfigure_service src/reconfigure_service.cpp) add_dependencies(rtt_dynamic_reconfigure_tests_service ${PROJECT_NAME}_gencfg) `reconfigure_service.cpp` source file instantiates `rtt_dynamic_reconfigure::Server<ConfigType>` config type `MyPackageConfig`, implements `rtt_dynamic_reconfigure::Updater<ConfigType>` class explains fill config PropertyBag vice-versa registers server service plugin: ```cpp #include <rtt_dynamic_reconfigure/server.h> #include <my_package/MyPackageConfig.h> header created generate_dynamic_reconfigure_options(cfg/MyPackage.cfg) namespace my_package; namespace rtt_dynamic_reconfigure template struct Updater<MyPackageConfig> static bool propertiesFromConfig(MyPackageConfig &config, uint32_t level, RTT::PropertyBag &bag) setProperty<int>("int_param", bag, config.int_param); setProperty<double>("double_param", bag, config.double_param); setProperty<std::string>("str_param", bag, config.str_param); setProperty<bool>("bool_param", bag, config.bool_param); return true; static bool configFromProperties(MyPackageConfig &config, const RTT::PropertyBag &bag) getProperty<int>("int_param", bag, config.int_param); getProperty<double>("double_param", bag, config.double_param); getProperty<std::string>("str_param", bag, config.str_param); getProperty<bool>("bool_param", bag, config.bool_param); return true; namespace rtt_dynamic_reconfigure RTT_DYNAMIC_RECONFIGURE_SERVICE_PLUGIN(MyPackageConfig, "my_package_reconfigure") `rtt_dynamic_reconfigure::setProperty<T>(...)` `rtt_dynamic_reconfigure::getProperty<T>(...)` helper functions `Updater` implementation. Properties exist owner's TaskContext created automatically. Alternatively, TaskContext service loaded inherit implement `Updater<MyPackageConfig>` class case provide specialized version *Note:* `Updater<ConfigType>::propertiesFromConfig(...)` implementation create properties references respective fields `ConfigType` struct. case properties added `bag->addProperty(const std::string &attr)` `rtt_dynamic_reconfigure::setProperty<T>(...)` helper function. service plugin compiled load component. properties names ```cpp import("rtt_ros"); ros.import("my_package"); loadService("my_component", "my_package_reconfigure") my_component.reconfigure.advertise("~/my_component") Overriding update operation rtt_dynamic_reconfigure updates properties TaskContext standard `RTT::updateProperties()` call running owner's thread. Properties updated `updateHook()` executed. case control property updates, add `bool updateProperties(const RTT::PropertyBag &source, uint32_t level)` operation custom implementation owner component. operation exists, default implementation. `source` bag bag filled previous `Updater<ConfigType>::propertiesFromConfig(...)` call. Adding property update notification callback required component notified properties updated rtt_dynamic_reconfigure. `void notifyPropertiesUpdated(uint32_t level)` operation exists, called parameter update ROS service call. Service API reconfigure.advertise(string Advertise dynamic_reconfigure topics service server namespace reconfigure.updated() Notifies rtt_dynamic_reconfigure server property values updated republished update user interface. reconfigure.refresh() Refreshs config description updated minimum, maximum default values. `AutoConfig` config type rediscovers newly added properties removes deleted reconfigure.min, reconfigure.max, reconfigure.dflt `PropertyBag`s mirror properties dynamic_reconfigure config hold minimum, maximum default values. Call `reconfigure.refresh()` update republish updated config description.

entries.name: rtt_ros
entries.description:
This package provides an RTT plugin to add a ROS node to the RTT process,
    as well as several wrapper scripts to enable roslaunching of orocos
    programs.
entries.readme: RTT ROS package tools building running Orocos components integrated ROS architecture. RTT Services ROS Package Import Chaining Service "ros" RTT service import RTT plugins built ROS package plugins depend. dependencies package.xml files `<export>` section. RTT plugins ROS package "my\_package\_name" dependencies imported running Orocos .ops script calling operation "ros" global service): ```python import("rtt_ros") ros.import("my_pkg_name") `rtt_ros` package imported normal mechanism. loads `ros` service, ROS import function, `ros.import()`, parse ROS package metadata import Orocos plugins named package packages listed `<rtt_ros><plugin_depend>PKG_NAME</plugin_depend></rtt_ros>` tags `<export>` section package.xml files. Catkin introduces dependency types buildtime, development, purposes. order RTT plugin depdencencies clear, avoid load orocos components package dependency, extensible ROS metadata `<export>` tag. loading plugins package `pkg_one` necessitate loading plugins packages `rtt_roscomm` `pkg_two`, `pkg_one/package.xml` ```xml <package> <name>pkg_one</name> <export> <rtt_ros> <plugin_depend>rtt_roscomm</plugin_depend> <plugin_depend>pkg_two</plugin_depend> </rtt_ros> </export> </package> Launch Files **[deployer.launch](launch/deployer.launch)** Launch orocos deployer **LOG_LEVEL** (default "info") Orocos log level **DEPLOYER_ARGS** (default Additional arguments passed deployer **OROCOS_TARGET** (default `$OROCOS_TARGET`) **RTT_COMPONENT_PATH** (default `$LD_LIBRARY_PATH`) **DEBUG** (default `false`) Launch deployer GDB. Launchfile Examples deployer launched including launchfile launchfile ```xml <launch> <include file="$(find rtt_ros)/launch/deployer.launch"> <arg name="DEPLOYER_ARGS" value="-s $(find rtt_ros_integration_example)/example.ops"/> <arg name="LOG_LEVEL" value="debug"/> <arg name="DEBUG" value="false"/> </include> </launch> Wrapper Scripts deployer orocreate-pkg orogen orogen-unregister rttlua rttlua-tlsf rttscript typegen

entries.name: rtt_rosclock
entries.description: This package provides an RTT plugin to access different time measurements on a realtime host.
entries.readme: RTT ROSClock package helpful functions measuring time sources realtime operating system. running Orocos components ROS network, important time synchronized machines. standard `RTT::TimeService` calls query time, **tens seconds** NTP-corrected time timestamped messages published ROS dramatically delayed. avoid problems staying realtime-safe portable), `rtt_rosclock::host_now()` function ROS time structure `CLOCK_HOST_REALTIME` realtime time source Xenomai system. gnu/linux system, call return result standard `ros::Time::now()` function. host_now() broadcasting ROS Header Stamps `rtt_rosclock::host_now()` function time source ROS header timestamps time broadcast ROS messages machines processes. assumed `/clock` topic active, ROS messages broadcasted based time source. compiled Xenomai running simulation mode, function return NTP-synchronized clock time `CLOCK_HOST_REALTIME` clock source. *Note supported Xenomai compiled Xenomai running simulation mode, pass-through `ros::Time::now()`. running simulation mode, simulation clock, based ROS `/clock` topic. pass-through `rtt_rosclock::rtt_now()`. RTT Services Clock Service "rosclock" RTT service sub-service global "ros" service called "ros.clock" operations: `ros::Time ros.clock.host_now(void)` ROS time structure NTP-adjusted realtime clock sim clock. `ros::Time ros.clock.host_wall_now(void)` ROS time structure NTP-adjusted realtime clock wall clock. `ros::Time ros.clock.rtt_now(void)` ROS time structure RTT clock sim clock. `ros::Time ros.clock.rtt_wall_now(void)` ROS time structure RTT wall clock. `RTT::Seconds ros.clock.host_offset_from_rtt(void)` differences RTT wall clock source NTP-adjusted realtime clock source. API calls `rtt_rosclock/rtt_rosclock.h` header: `ros::Time rtt_rosclock::host_now(void)` `ros::Time rtt_rosclock::host_wall_now(void)` `ros::Time rtt_rosclock::rtt_now(void)` `ros::Time rtt_rosclock::rtt_wall_now(void)` `RTT::Seconds rtt_rosclock::host_offset_from_rtt(void)` Simulation Clock Activity package RTT `SimClockActivity` periodically execute task subject progression simulated clock source. clock source ROS `/clock` topic exists `/use_sim_time` parameter set `true`, manual time update in-process source. simulation clock activity implemented classes: `SimClockActivity` actual activity executes task. `SimClockActivityManager` singleton class responsible coordinating execution `SimClockActivity` periodically (subject minimum desired periods). `SimClockThread` singleton thread responsible acutal updates `RTT::os::TimeService` optinally subscribing ROS messages `/clock` topic. default, `SimClockThread` running, started, override normal RTT `TimeService` update based update rate `SimClockThread` clock source. Usage `SimClockActivity` similarly `RTT::PeriodicActivity`. `rtt_rosclock` service plugin loaded, set number tasks' activities SimClockActivities, set clock source, enable `SimClockThread`. ```cpp import("rtt_ros"); ros.import("rtt_rosclock"); create components my_component_1.setPeriod(0.01); my_component_2.setPeriod(1.0); Set simulation clock activities ros.clock.setSimClockActivity(my_component_1); ros.clock.setSimClockActivity(my_component_2); Set SimClockThread ROS /clock topic time ros.clock.useROSClockTopic(); Start simulation clock thread override RTT clock ros.clock.enableSim();

entries.name: rtt_roscomm
entries.description:
rtt_roscomm provides the necessary template files and cmake macros for
    automatic rtt typekit and transport generation from ROS msg files
entries.readme: RTT ROS Communications ***Nomenclature Warning:*** "ROS Service" remote procedure call hapens ROS communication protocols "Orocos/RTT Service" grouping properties, functions, data ports. "ROS Services" satisfy similar role "Orocos/RTT Operations".* Contents package serves purposes. Orocos RTT Service publishing subscribing ROS topics Orocos RTT Services calling serving ROS services Orocos typekits ROS message primitive types template generating wrapper packages ROS .msg .srv files typekits .msg files transport plugin .msg files ros service proxy factories .srv files Plugins ROS Topics package global RTT service creating real-time-safe connections ROS topics Orocos RTT data ports. package Orocos connection policies: buffered unbuffered connections ROS topics. Publishing subscribing command, topic type inferred Orocos port type. Connection policies created operations: `rostopic.connection(TOPIC_NAME)`: Creates connection buffer length `rostopic.bufferedConnection(TOPIC_NAME, BUFFER_LENGTH)`: Creates connection user-supplied buffer length. `rostopic.unbufferedConnection(TOPIC_NAME)`: Creates unbuffered connection, writing thread immediately publishs message (publishing real-time safe. Note `TOPIC_NAME` prefixed tilde resolved process's private namespace, similarly topic names resolved rospy. ROS Services package global RTT service task-scoped service facilitating communication ROS services. global service, `rosservice_registry` register factories creating proxies ROS service clients servers. task-scoped service ued bind RTT operations operation callers ROS services. general, users task-scoped RTT service, similarly `rtt_rosparam` service task-scoped RTT service `rosservice` operations: `rosservice.connect(RTT_OPERATION_NAME, ROS_SERVICE_NAME, ROS_SERVICE_TYPE)` Connect RTT operation ROS service. Note function RTT operation operation operation caller. `RTT_OPERATION_NAME`: task-scoped operation/operation caller provided/required services separated dots `foo.bar.baz.op`) `ROS_SERVICE_NAME`: service client/server ROS graph `/some/ros/ns/my_service`) `ROS_SERVICE_TYPE`: full typename service `std_srvs/Empty`) global RTT service `rosservice_registry` operations: `rosservice_registry.registerServiceFactory(FACTORY)`: Register ROS service factory `rosservice_registry.hasServiceFactory(TYPENAME)`: Check ROS service type registered `rosservice_registry.geServiceFactory(TYPENAME)`: ROS service client/server factory Code Generation package facilities generating typekits ROS service types defined `.srv` files generating plugins register ROS service types `rosservice_registry` service. Usage Connecting Orocos Port ROS Topic ```python Imports import("rtt_roscomm") Publish stream("my_component.my_output", ros.comm.topic("my_ros_output")) Subscribe stream("my_component.my_input", ros.comm.topic("my_ros_input")) set connections code: ```cpp #include <rtt_roscomm/rtt_rostopic.h> Add port stream ROS topic this->ports()->addPort("my_port", my_port_); my_port_.createStream(rtt_roscomm::topic("my_ros_topic")); create privately-scoped component-scoped topic, Privately-scoped (resolves NODE_NAME/TOPIC_NAME) my_port_.createStream(rtt_roscomm::topic("~my_private_ros_topic")); Component-scoped (resolves NODE_NAME/COMPONENT_NAME/TOPIC_NAME) my_port_.createStream(rtt_roscomm::topic("~" this->getName() "/my_component_scoped_ros_topic")); Connecting RTT Operations ROS Services connect Orocos operation ROS service .ops script Orocos DeploymentComponent: ```python Imports import("rtt_roscomm") import("rtt_std_srvs") Load application-specific component loadComponent("some_component_name","some_component_package::SomeComponent") Load rosservice RTT service components loadService("some_component_name","rosservice") Expose operation component ROS service some_component_name.rosservice.connect( "some_provided_service.some_operation", "/some/ros/namespace/empty", "std_srvs/Empty") Expose ROS service component some_component_name.rosservice.connect( "some_Required_service.some_operation_caller", "/some/ros/namespace/empty", "std_srvs/Empty") Making Package's ROS .msg .srv Types Generally, create catkin package simply `create_rtt_msgs` script running: ```bash rosrun rtt_roscomm create_rtt_msgs my_msgs create package CMakeLists.txt package.xml: ```cmake project(rtt_my_msgs) find_package(catkin REQUIRED COMPONENTS rtt_roscomm) Generate typekits ros .msg files ros_generate_rtt_typekit(my_msgs) Generate plugin services my_msgs ros_generate_rtt_service_proxies(my_msgs) Call orocos_generate_package() export proper targets orocos_generate_package( DEPENDS my_msgs DEPENDS_TARGETS rtt_roscomm `ros_generate_rtt_service_proxies()` cmake function generate RTT plugin registers factories services named package plugin loaded. Design ROS Services `rosservice_registry` RTT service list ROS service clients servers RTT operations operationcallers, `rosservice.connect` operation, inspects argument Operation OperationCaller. **RTT Operation**, instantiate **ROS service server** wrapped **RTT OperationCaller** call operation. **RTT OperationCaller**, instantiate **ROS service client** wrapped **RTT Operation** called operation caller. required services wrapper operations operation callers created private `rosservice` service. Todo Implement typekit generation (similar rtt\_rostopic) services called taskbrowser. Automatically detect type ROS service service operation signature.

entries.readme: rtt_rospack package easy access rospack Orocos RTT order resolve path ROS package current system. Usage resolve path ROS package system importing rtt_rospack find: ```cpp import("rtt_ros"); ros.import("rtt_rospack"); extends 'ros' service 'find' function var string the_path ros.find("actionlib");

entries.name: rtt_rosparam
entries.description: This package provides an RTT service and service-requester for associating RTT component properties with ROS parameters
entries.readme: RTT ROSParam package RTT service service-requester associating RTT component properties ROS parameters. Design RTT service enables setting/getting individual RTT properties RTT component to/from ROS parameter server, setting/getting properties component simultaneously. operations map operations roscpp library, store retrieved values RTT properties component. service requires RTT properties component match names ROS parameters, modulo namespace resolution policy Usage Service Interface Constants resolution policies): ***RELATIVE*** Relative resolution: ***ABSOLUTE*** Absolute resolution: ***PRIVATE*** Private resolution: ***COMPONENT*** Component resolution: "~COMPONENT\_NAME/name" Operations (getting/setting params) Operations properties **getAll()** **getAllComponentPrivate()** Attempt properties component sub-services) ROS parameter server **COMPONENT** namespace. **getAllRelative()** Attempt properties component sub-services) ROS parameter server relative namespace. **getAllAbsolute()** Attempt properties component sub-services) ROS parameter server absolute namespace. **getAllPrivate()** Attempt properties component sub-services) ROS parameter server node's private namespace. Operations setting properties **setAll()** **setAllComponentPrivate()** Stores properties component sub-services) ROS parameter server similarly-named property **COMPONENT**'s private namespace. **setAllRelative()** Stores properties component sub-services) ROS parameter server similarly-named property relative namespace. **setAllAbsolute()** Stores properties component sub-services) ROS parameter server similarly-named property absolute namespace. **setAllPrivate()** Stores properties component sub-services) ROS parameter server similarly-named property node's private namespace. Operations single properties **getParam(ros_name, rtt_name)** ROS param **ros_name** store RTT property **rtt_name**. leaders private absolute resolution. **get(name ,policy)** Attempt property named populates properties named RTT sub-service) ROS parameter namespace **policy**. **getRelative(name)** **getAbsolute(name)** **getPrivate(name)** **getComponentPrivate(name)** Operations setting single properties **setParam(ros_name, rtt_name)** Set ROS param **ros_name** RTT property **rtt_name**. leaders private absolute resolution. **set(name, policy)** Attempt set property named stores properties named RTT sub-service) ROS parameter namespace **policy**. **setRelative(name)** **setAbsolute(name)** **setPrivate(name)** **setComponentPrivate(name)** Scripting Interface Components meant ROS parameters properties set ROS parameter server scripting interface: Import packages import("rtt_ros") ros.import("rtt_rosparam") Create components laodService("my_component","rosparam") parameters component namespace "~my_component/..." my_component.rosparam.getAll() "robot_description" property absolute namespace "/robot_description" my_component.rosparam.getAbsolute("robot_description") Alternatively: my_component.rosparam.get("robot_description",my_component.rosparam.ABSOLUTE) Interface component designed ROS parameters, easily access rosparam service RTT ServiceRequester. simple component "robot\_description" ROS param global namespace ("/robot\_description") "publish\_period" ROS param node's private namespace ("~publish\_period") ```cpp Include service requester interface #include <rtt_rosparam/rosparam.h> class MyComponent public RTT::TaskContext private: Storage RTT properties std::string robot_description_; double publish_period_; public: MyComponent::MyComponent(std::string RTT::TaskContext(name) Add properties this->addProperty("robot_description",robot_description_); this->addProperty("publish_period",publish_period_); bool configureHook() bool all_params_found true; rosparam service requester boost::shared_ptr<rtt_rosparam::ROSParam> rosparam this->getProvider<rtt_rosparam::ROSParam>("rosparam"); parameters if(rosparam) ROS parameter "/robot_description" all_params_found rosparam->getAbsolute("robot_description"); ROS parameter "~publish_period" all_params_found rosparam->getPrivate("publish_priod"); return all_params_found; API documentation information.

entries.name: rtt_tf
entries.description: This package contains the components of the rtt_tf package
entries.readme: RTT package Orocos RTT component utilizing rigid body transform library Orocos. component service operations requesting broadcasting sing batch transforms. Usage general, process single component. component operations bare interface RTT service. "lookupTransform" Lookup transform source target. "target", Target frame "source", Source frame "lookupTransformAtTime" Lookup transform source target specific time. "target", Target frame "source", Source frame "common\_time", `ros::Time` common time transform computed "broadcastTransform" Broadcast stamped transform immediately. "transform", `geometry\_msgs::TransformStamped` "broadcastTransforms" Broadcast stamped transform immediately. "transforms", `std::vector<geometry_msgs::TransformStamped>` operations, instantiate `rtt_tf::RTT_TF` component, connect components intend ```cpp import("rtt_ros"); Import load component ros.import("rtt_tf"); loadComponent("tf","rtt_tf::RTT_TF"); Connect operations component's service component's required service (easily created API shown section) loadComponent("my_component","MyComponent"); connectServices("my_component","tf"); API [rtt\_tf/tf\_interface.h](include/rtt_tf/tf_interface.h) header includes `rtt_tf::TFInterface` class adds required service RTT component. easily connecting component. create RTT service requester ```cpp #include <rtt_tf/tf_interface.h> class MyComponent public RTT::TaskContext private: rtt_tf::TFInterface public: MyComponent(std::string RTT::TaskContext(name), Add services tf_(this) bool startHook() ready connected return tf_.ready(); void updateHook() Lookup transform geometry_msgs::TransformStamped tform tf_.lookupTransform("/world","/my_frame");

entries.name: rtt_actionlib_msgs
entries.description:
Provides an rtt typekit for ROS actionlib_msgs messages.

    It allows you to use ROS messages transparently in
    RTT components and applications.

    This package was automatically generated by the
    create_rtt_msgs generator and should not be manually
    modified.

    See the http://ros.org/wiki/actionlib_msgs documentation
    for the documentation of the ROS messages in this
    typekit.

entries.name: rviz_visual_tools
entries.description: Helper functions for displaying and debugging data in Rviz via published markers
entries.readme: Rviz Visual Tools Helper functions displaying debugging data Rviz published markers. package includes: Basic geometric markers Rviz Developed [Dave Coleman](http://dav.ee) Correll Robotics Lab, University Colorado Boulder contributors. Add class's member variables: visualizing rviz rviz_visual_tools::VisualToolsPtr visual_tools_; class' constructor add: visual_tools_.reset(new rviz_visual_tools::VisualTools("base_frame","/rviz_visual_markers")); Change parameter robot's base frame, parameter Rviz marker ROS topic. settings adjust, documenting future: visual_tools_->setMuted(false); visual_tools_->setLifetime(20.0); visual_tools_->setFloorToBaseHeight(floor_to_base_height); visual_tools_->setAlpha(alpha); visual_tools_->setGlobalScale(scale); visual_tools_->setBaseFrame(frame_name); Tools code easily debug code visual markers Rviz Start rviz create marker 'Add' button bottom Choose marker topic topic constructor. Code snippet create pose xyz rotate pose degrees axis. publish pose arrow visualziation Rviz. Rviz fixed frame chosen code. Create pose Eigen::Affine3d pose; pose Eigen::AngleAxisd(M_PI/4, Eigen::Vector3d::UnitY()); rotate axis degrees pose.translation() Eigen::Vector3d( translate x,y,z Publish arrow vector pose ROS_INFO_STREAM_NAMED("test","Publishing Arrow"); visual_tools_->publishArrow(pose, rviz_visual_tools::RED, rviz_visual_tools::LARGE); Basic Publishing Functions ``visual_tools.h`` details documentation functions: publishSphere publishArrow publishRectangle publishLine publishBlock publishText publishTest Helper Functions Reset function ``deleteAllMarkers`` tells Rviz clear current markers displayed. withs ROS Indigo newer. Conversion functions convertPose convertPoint32ToPose convertPoseToPoint convertPoint convertPoint32 Convenience functions generateRandomPose dRand fRand iRand getCenterPoint getVectorBetweenPoints Colors package helps quickly choose colors feel free send PRs colors needed rviz_visual_tools::RED rviz_visual_tools::GREEN rviz_visual_tools::BLUE rviz_visual_tools::GREY rviz_visual_tools::WHITE rviz_visual_tools::ORANGE rviz_visual_tools::BLACK rviz_visual_tools::YELLOW Marker Sizes rviz_visual_tools::XXSMALL rviz_visual_tools::XSMALL rviz_visual_tools::SMALL rviz_visual_tools::REGULAR rviz_visual_tools::LARGE rviz_visual_tools::XLARGE Lifetime markers persist duration set ``setLifetime``, defaulting seconds. reset earlier calling resetMarkerCounts(); markers overwrite older delete markers ROS Indigo) calling deleteAllMarkers(); Developers Notes notes wanting dig deeper: poses published respect world frame /world, /odom, /base publish() ROS topics ``ros::spinOnce();`` sleep load features/publishers needed library components Contribute Feel free send PRs helper functions, fixes, happily discuss merge send time helping people busy grad student. risk.

entries.name: schunk_simulated_tactile_sensors
entries.description:
This package provides simulated tactile sensors for the Schunk Dextrous
     Hand (SDH) which is mounted on the Care-O-bot arm. The node subscribes to
     the Gazebo bumper topics of the SDH. It transforms the Gazebo feedback to
     the "tactile_data" topic to provide the same tactile sensor interface as
     the schunk_sdh package.
     
     The following parameters can be set:
     * cells_x: The number of patches on the tactile sensor in the direction
                perpendicular to the finger. Defaults to 6.
     * cells_y: The number of patches on the tactile sensor along the direction
                of the finger. Defaults to 14.
     * output_range: The maximum output value of one patch. Defaults to 3500.
     * sensitivity: The change of output in one patch per Newton. Defaults to
                    350. The sensitivity can be approximated by the following
                    formula: S = output_range / (measurement_range * cell_area)
                    - The measurement range of the tactile pads is 250 kPa (from
                      the data sheet).
                    - The output range can be determined by experiment from the
                      real SDH. It is about 3500.
                    - The cell area is the size of one patch. Length and width
                      of the area are determined by dividing the length/width
                      of the collision surface by the number of cells in the
                      respective direction.
                      Important: In most cases this is NOT the cell area that is
                                 given in the data sheet!
     * filter_length: The length of the moving average filter which smoothes
                      the values from simulation. Defaults to 10.
     
     The node subscribes to the following topics to receive data from the
     simulation:
     * thumb_2/state
     * thumb_3/state
     * finger_12/state
     * finger_13/state
     * finger_22/state
     * finger_23/state
     
     The node publishes the processed data on the following topic:
     * tactile_data
     
     The simulated bumper must obtain the collision data in the link that the
     sensor is attached to. This is achieved by setting the "frameName" property
     in the gazebo_ros_bumper controller.

entries.name: serial
entries.description: Serial is a cross-platform, simple to use library for using serial ports on computers.  This library provides a C++, object oriented interface for interacting with RS-232 like devices on Linux and Windows.
entries.readme: Serial Communication Library cross-platform library interfacing serial ports written modern interface workflow designed feel PySerial, speed control library robotics related projects built installed unix libraries sudo install, catkin project built side catkin projects catkin workspace. Serial class basic interface common serial libraries (open, close, read, write, requires extra dependencies. tight control timeouts control handshaking lines. Documentation Website: http://wjwwood.github.com/serial/ API Documentation: http://wjwwood.github.com/serial/doc/1.1.0/index.html Dependencies [catkin](http://www.ros.org/wiki/catkin) cmake Python based buildsystem [cmake](http://www.cmake.org) buildsystem [Python](http://www.python.org) scripting language [empy](http://www.alcyone.com/pyos/empy/) Python templating library [catkin_pkg](http://pypi.python.org/pypi/catkin_pkg/) Runtime Python library catkin Install code: git clone https://github.com/wjwwood/serial.git Build: Build run tests: test Build documentation: docs Install: install Uninstall: uninstall License MIT License Copyright William Woodall, John Harrison Permission granted, free charge, person obtaining copy software documentation files "Software"), deal Software restriction, including limitation rights copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies Software, permit persons Software furnished subject conditions: copyright notice permission notice included copies substantial portions Software. This is a ROS interface to the Shadow Robot's robotic hand. It
     contains both an interface to the real hand (communicating via
     a CAN interface) and a simulated version of the hand. It also
     contains an interface to Shadow Robot's muscle arm.

entries.name: sr_kinematics
entries.description:
A specific shadowhand package derived from arm_kinematics, for computing both forward and backward kinematics for the fingers except thumb.
    Solution is analytic. Developed as an alternative to arm_kinematics that cannot solve coupled joints.

entries.name: sr_edc_launch
entries.description: Package with launch files to start the needed nodes for the Shadow Robot EtherCAT hand.
entries.authors: Ugo Cupcic Yann Sionneau Toni Oliver
entries.readme: sr_edc_launch package launchfiles Shadow Robot EDC (EtherCAT Dual hand. Contents `sr_edc.launch` Launches single hand `sr_edc_bimanual.launch` Launches hands part bimanual robot) Direct single hand, default parameters: roslaunch sr_edc_launch sr_edc.launch bimanual system serial numbers left hand: roslaunch sr_edc_launch sr_edc_bimanual.launch rh_serial:=1234 lh_serial:=1235 launchfile bimanual system: <launch> <include file="$(find sr_edc_launch)/sr_edc_bimanual.launch" <arg name="rh_serial" <arg name="lh_serial" <arg name="eth_port" value="eth0_eth1" <arg name="robot_description" value="$(find sr_description)/robots/bimanual_shadowhand_motor.urdf.xacro" </include> </launch> single hand system: <launch> <include file="$(find sr_edc_launch)/sr_edc.launch" <arg name="eth_port" value="eth1" <arg name="robot_description" value="$(find sr_description)/robots/shadowhand_motor_biotac.urdf.xacro" </include> </launch> arguments sr_edc_bimanual.launch `eth_port`: ethernet port/s search etherCAT devices (shadow hands devices RoNeX). port argument, underscore separator. roslaunch sr_edc_launch sr_edc_bimanual.launch rh_serial:=1234 lh_serial:=1235 eth_port:=eth0_eth1 `debug`: Set true debugging `calibration_controllers`: Set run calibration controllers muscle hand) `robot_description`: Xacro file robot description load `pwm_control`: control mode PWM (true) torque (false) `rh_serial`: ethercat serial number hand `rh_id`: hand. trailing underscore) prefix hand model. `lh_serial`: ethercat serial number left hand `lh_id`: left hand. trailing underscore) prefix hand model. arguments sr_edc.launch `eth_port`: ethernet port/s search etherCAT devices (shadow hands devices RoNeX). port argument, underscore separator. `debug`: Set true debugging `calibration_controllers`: Set run calibration controllers muscle hand) `robot_description`: Xacro file robot description load `pwm_control`: control mode PWM (true) torque (false) `config_dir`: Defines sub-directory $(find sr_ethercat_hand_config)/mappings/ $(find sr_ethercat_hand_config)/calibrations/ $(find sr_ethercat_hand_config)/controls/host/ find parameters hand. case hand parameter meaning desired params root directories "hand_2/"

entries.name: gmapping
entries.description:
This package contains a ROS wrapper for OpenSlam's Gmapping. 
  The gmapping package provides laser-based SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping), 
  as a ROS node called slam_gmapping. Using slam_gmapping, you can create a 2-D occupancy
  grid map (like a building floorplan) from laser and pose data collected by a mobile robot.

entries.readme: softkinetic_camera General description package implements node runs interactive gesture camera (softkinetic) ROS package ROS, DepthSenseSDK linux downloaded. download http://www.softkinetic.com/fr-be/support/download.aspx?EntryId=517 download, create free account Parameters **camera_link** *(string, default: "/softkinetic_link")* frame camera. **confidence_threshold** *(int, default: Confidence threshold DepthNode configuration. Sensor noise filtered increasing threshold. Threshold Published Topics **depth_registered/points** *(sensor_msgs::PointCloud2)* Publishes point clouds detected camera. **rgb_data** *(sensor_msgs::Image)* Publishes rgb-images bgr8 encoding. Add camera robot model explain import softkinetic camera robot xacro file. included descriptor Creative Senz3D camera, addapt Softkinetic camera trivial. import xacro file describing camera macro: <xacro:include filename="$(find softkinetic_camera)/urdf/senz3d.urdf.xacro"/> include robot description file, <sensor_senz3d parent="base_link" name="senz3d_camera"> <origin xyz="0.05 rpy="0.0 </sensor_senz3d>

    implementations for Turtlebot and Roomba. Port

    turtlebot_driver pending review by the entire create community
    before using the name create_driver.
  
    For ROS bindings, please see turtlebot_node.

entries.name: typelib
entries.description:
This library offers an introspection mechanism for C/C++ value-types. I.e.
      it offers a way to represent types, and to manipulate in-memory values
      that are instances of those types.

      A Ruby binding is included, which gives a fast and transparent
      modification of C/C++ in-memory types from Ruby, and an associated
      interface to call C functions from shared libraries.

entries.name: visp_auto_tracker
entries.description:
Online automated pattern-based object tracker relying on visual servoing.

    visp_auto_tracker wraps model-based trackers provided by ViSP visual
    servoing library into a ROS package. The tracked object should have a
    QRcode of Flash code pattern. Based on the pattern, the object is
    automaticaly detected. The detection allows then to initialise the
    model-based trackers. When lost of tracking achieves a new detection
    is performed that will be used to re-initialize the tracker.

    This computer vision algorithm computes the pose (i.e. position and
    orientation) of an object in an image. It is fast enough to allow
    object online tracking using a camera.
entries.readme: visp_auto_tracker visp_auto_tracker wraps model-based trackers ViSP visual servoing library ROS package. tracked object QRcode Flash code pattern. Based pattern, object automaticaly detected. detection initialise model-based trackers. lost tracking achieves detection performed re-initialize tracker. computer vision algorithm computes pose position orientation) object image. fast object online tracking camera. package composed node called 'visp_auto_tracker'. node detect QRcode Flash code object. detection performed, node tracks object. lost tracking occurs node detect object restart tracking. viewer comming visp_tracker package monitor tracking result. [Project webpage ros.org: tutorial API reference] [ros-homepage] [Project webpage: source code download, bug report] [github-homepage] Setup package submodules. compiled ROS package `catkin_make`. Prerequisities visp_auto_tracker depends visp_bridge visp_tracker packages <https://github.com/lagadic/vision_visp> (indigo-devel branches). visp_auto_tracker depends libdmtx-dev libzbar-dev system dependencies. install run: sudo apt-get install libdmtx-dev libzbar-dev build visp_tracker Supposed catkin work space run: ~/catkin_ws/src git clone indigo-devel https://github.com/lagadic/vision_visp.git catkin_make --pkg visp_auto_tracker Documentation documentation project [ROS homepage] [ros-homepage]. information, refer [ROS tutorial] [ros-tutorial-building-pkg]. [github-homepage]: https://github.com/lagadic/visp_auto_tracker [ros-homepage]: http://www.ros.org/wiki/visp_auto_tracker [ros-tutorial-building-pkg]: http://www.ros.org/wiki/ROS/Tutorials/BuildingPackages "Building ROS Package"

Prerequisities visp_camera_calibration depends visp_bridge package <https://github.com/lagadic/vision_visp> (groovy-devel branch). build visp_camera_calibration Supposed catkin work space run: ~/catkin_ws/src git clone groovy-devel https://github.com/lagadic/vision_visp.git catkin_make --pkg visp_camera_calibration Documentation [Project webpage ros.org] [ros-homepage] [Project webpage: source code download, bug report] [github-homepage] [github-homepage]: https://github.com/lagadic/visp_camera_calibration [ros-homepage]: http://www.ros.org/wiki/visp_camera_calibration

entries.name: visp_tracker
entries.description:
Wraps the ViSP moving edge tracker provided by the ViSP visual
    servoing library into a ROS package.

    This computer vision algorithm computes the pose (i.e. position
    and orientation) of an object in an image. It is fast enough to
    allow object online tracking using a camera.
entries.readme: visp_tracker visp_tracker wraps ViSP moving edge tracker ViSP visual servoing library ROS package. computer vision algorithm computes pose position orientation) object image. fast object online tracking camera. package composed node called 'tracker' additional binaries 'client' 'viewer'. node track object fast initialized client. viewer monitor tracking result. [Project webpage ros.org: tutorial API reference] [ros-homepage] [Project webpage: source code download, bug report] [github-homepage] Setup package compiled catkin package `catkin_make`. Prerequisities install ViSP system dependency. achived `ros-indigo-visp` package Ubuntu. run: sudo apt-get install ros-indigo-visp package case Fedora) version ViSP, install ViSP source: svn checkout svn://scm.gforge.inria.fr/svn/visp/trunk/ViSP ViSP cmake -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON version setup `VISP_DIR` environment variable folder build. case export VISP_DIR=~/ViSP build visp_tracker Supposed catkin work space run: ~/catkin_ws/src git clone indigo-devel https://github.com/lagadic/vision_visp.git catkin_make --pkg visp_tracker Documentation documentation project [ROS homepage] [ros-homepage]. information, refer [ROS tutorial] [ros-tutorial-building-pkg]. [github-homepage]: https://github.com/laas/visp_tracker [ros-homepage]: http://www.ros.org/wiki/visp_tracker [ros-tutorial-building-pkg]: http://www.ros.org/wiki/ROS/Tutorials/BuildingPackages "Building ROS Package"

entries.name: xdot
entries.description:
XDot.py, by Jose Fonseca, is an interactive viewer for graphs written in
    Graphviz's dot language.

    This package adds front-end capabilities to XDot including WX Widget
    support and experimental Qt support and a mechanism for receiving callbacks
    when nodes are clicked.  This extension is provided as BSD.
entries.authors: Jose Fonseca Jonathan Bohren Alex Bravo

entries.readme: Overview package simply collects ar_track_alvar marker output stores tracking observations tracking information easy container. features: Throws observations tracked Observation data includes confidence (frame movement consideration), persistence, stability. Sense Sense? hook ar_track_alvar node kinect give stability results, mind fail move sensor's minimum range rgb mode sensing) good paired tracking algorithm alternative package), roslaunchers Usage Launching openni ar_track_alvar roslaunch yocs_ar_marker_tracking machinery.launch roslaunch yocs_ar_marker_tracking tracking.launch Debugging Fire `rqt_logger_level` set node's logger level debug. full marker information generated statistics Testing test script playing around/testing marker output. designed paired tracking mind, checking difference kinect kinect. left marker marker marker size change launchers). roslaunch yocs_ar_marker_tracking testies-3dsensor.launch hooking sensor ar_track_alvar node... roslaunch yocs_ar_marker_tracking testies-3dsensor-depth.launch rosrun yocs_ar_marker_tracking testies.py Understanding Script https://docs.google.com/a/yujinrobot.com/drawings/d/1zEwZM1QMsz9F_NJ6jWP-5vxME7HIXXL_2q45sDt81_w/edit?usp=sharing calculated target heading relative camera rgb pose script set target location front wall inbetween markers.

Detection rates position data hand reliable, position data markers provide robustness marker data Usage Markers left marker marker default, configurable parameters node. Publishers `~/spotted_markers` string identifying markers spotted 'none', 'left', 'right', 'both'. `~/initial_pose` pose covariance stamped set initial pose amcl (assuming `/map` base midpoint markers. `~relative_target_pose` pose sensor target location, approach controller. Todo Remove transform logic node publish relative target pose. removes node external information case camera_rgb_optical_frame base_footprint transform).

entries.name: yocs_cmd_vel_mux
entries.description:
A multiplexer for command velocity inputs. Arbitrates incoming cmd_vel messages from several topics,
     allowing one topic at a time to command the robot, based on priorities. It also deallocates current
     allowed topic if no messages are received after a configured timeout. All topics, together with their
     priority and timeout are configured through a YAML file, that can be reload at runtime.

entries.name: yocs_math_toolkit
entries.description:
Math toolkit for Yujin open control system. This package is intended to contain common use functions,
    mostly for simple mathematics but also for tf-related conversions.
    By no means it pretends to be an efficient and robust, widely used math library, but a play ground where
    to put common code that is typically repeated in many robot control programs.

entries.name: adhoc_communication
entries.description: The adhoc_communication package allows to exchange data over an ad-hoc network setup by robots running the corresponding node. The package allows you to exchange data over serveral roscores by wrapping transmitting the data to the destination and publishing the data on a predefined topic at the destination host. Routing is accomplished using the hostname of the robots.

entries.name: explorer
entries.description: The explorer package utilizes frontier based exploration for multi-robot systems. Coordinated exploration enhances robot distribution and reduces redundancy in exploration reducing exploration time.

entries.name: clasp
entries.description:
This ROS package contains the clasp answer set solver for
    (extended) normal logic programs developed at the University of
    Potsdam.

    Clasp combines the high-level modeling capacities of answer set
    programming (ASP) with state-of-the-art techniques from the area
    of Boolean constraint solving. The primary clasp algorithm relies
    on conflict-driven nogood learning, a technique that proved very
    successful for satisfiability checking (SAT). Unlike other
    learning ASP solvers, clasp does not rely on legacy software, such
    as a SAT solver or any other existing ASP solver. Rather, clasp
    has been genuinely developed for answer set solving based on
    conflict-driven nogood learning. clasp can be applied as an ASP
    solver (on SMODELS format, as output by Gringo), as a SAT solver
    (on a simplified version of DIMACS/CNF format), or as a PB solver
    (on OPB format).

entries.readme: ROS OpenCV camera driver easy capture video device cv::VideoCapture OpenCV. cv_camera_node node [camera_info_manager](http://wiki.ros.org/camera_info_manager) dealing camera_info. calibration data set, dummy values width height. Publish ~image_raw (sensor_msgs/Image) ~camera_info (sensor_msgs/CameraInfo) Service ~set_camera_info (sensor_msgs/SetCameraInfo) Parameters ~rate (double: default publish rate ~device_id (int: default capture device ~frame_id (string: default "camera") frame_id message header. ~image_width (int) set capture image width. ~image_height (int) set capture image height. ~camera_info_url (string) url camera info yaml. ~file (string: default movie file device. Nodelet node works nodelet (cv_camera/CvCameraNodelet).

entries.name: gscam
entries.description:
A ROS camera driver that uses gstreamer to connect to
    devices such as webcams.
entries.authors: Jonathan Bohren Graylin Trevor Jay Christopher Crick
entries.readme: GSCam ROS package originally developed [Brown Robotics Lab](http://robotics.cs.brown.edu/) broadcasting [GStreamer](http://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/)-based video stream standard [ROS Camera API](http://ros.org/wiki/camera_drivers). fork fixes incorporated broadcast correct `sensor_msgs/Image` messages proper frames timestamps. ROS-like configuration control GStreamer interface. Note pacakge built rosbuild catkin workspaces. ROS API (stable) gscam run node nodelet. Nodes `gscam` Topics `camera/image_raw` `camera/camera_info` Services `camera/set_camera_info` Parameters `~camera_name`: camera (corrsponding camera info) `~camera_info_url`: url (`file://path/to/file`, `package://pkg_name/path/to/file`) [camera calibration file](http://www.ros.org/wiki/camera_calibration_parsers#File_formats). `~gscam_config`: GStreamer [configuration string](http://wiki.oz9aec.net/index.php?title=Gstreamer_cheat_sheet&oldid=1829). `~frame_id`: [TF](http://www.ros.org/wiki/tf) frame `~reopen_on_eof`: Re-open stream ends (EOF). `~sync_sink`: Synchronize app sink setting `false` resolve problems sub-par framerates). API (unstable) gscam library guaranteed stable. Examples launchfiles configs examples directory. examples [Video4Linux2](examples/v4l.launch): Standard [video4linux](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video4Linux)-based cameras USB webcams [Nodelet](examples/gscam_nodelet.launch): Run V4L-based camera nodelet [Video File](examples/videofile.launch): videofile readable GStreamer [DeckLink](examples/decklink.launch): [BlackMagic](http://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/decklink/models) DeckLink SDI capture cards (note: requires `gst-plugins-bad` plugins)
