entries.name: hrpsys
entries.readme: Introduction [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/start-jsk/hrpsys.png)](https://travis-ci.org/start-jsk/hrpsys) OpenRTM-aist-based robot controller. package tailored humanoid (dual-arm and/or biped) robots historical reason. contents:: Test Status [Hydro](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-hydro-hrpsys/) [![Build Status](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-hydro-hrpsys/badge/icon)](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-hydro-hrpsys/) [![Hydro Test Satus](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-hydro-hrpsys/test/trend)](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-hydro-hrpsys/) [Groovy](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-groovy-hrpsys/) [![Build Status](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-groovy-hrpsys/badge/icon)](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-groovy-hrpsys/) [![Groovy Test Satus](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-groovy-hrpsys/test/trend)](http://jenkins.ros.org/job/devel-groovy-hrpsys/) developers release version party package ROS extra chores release. Discussed [here](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/pull/99#issuecomment-49831482). NOTE repositories involved: [Upstream source repository (fkanehiro/hrpsys-base)](https://github.com/fkanehiro/hrpsys-base/issues) [ROS repository (start-jsk/hrpsys)](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/blob/master/CHANGELOG.rst) Steps: Send pull request [fkanehiro/hrpsys-base](https://github.com/fkanehiro/hrpsys-base/issues) update tag [CMakeLists.txt](https://github.com/fkanehiro/hrpsys-base/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt). [Example](https://github.com/fkanehiro/hrpsys-base/pull/231). community decide ready release. Update [start-jsk/hrpsys/Makefile.hrpsys-base](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/blob/master/Makefile.hrpsys-base) subsequent steps automation script produce valid result). [Example2](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/pull/88/files). Update [start-jsk/hrpsys/CHANGELOG.rst](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/blob/master/CHANGELOG.rst) steps. script [generate_changelog_upstream_] copy commit messages upstream `fkanehiro/hrpsys-base`. file created `/tmp`. Summarize commit messages user-meaningful content ([discussion](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/pull/99#issuecomment-49596002)). include updates [ROS repository (start-jsk/hrpsys)](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/blob/master/CHANGELOG.rst), add change logs created Generate changelog command `catkin`: roscd hrpsys catkin_generate_changelog Open generated/updated `CHANGELOG.rst` file. manually merge artifact follow normal release manner: Send pull requests change (step Update tags `package.xml` `catkin_prepare_release`. Notice sending pull requests repositories; source upstream repository ROS-dependent, repository release DEB ROS infrastructure. _generate_changelog_upstream: Generate changelog upstream `hrpsys` consists resources repositories noted [package.xml](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/blob/master/package.xml). generate changelog [upstream repository](https://github.com/fkanehiro/hrpsys-base), covered convenient tool ROS called `catkin_generate_changelog` takes care catkin packages, `start-jsk/hrpsys` purpose custom script [create_changelog.sh](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/blob/master/create_changelog.sh) helps Clone repository catkin workspace %CATKIN_WORKSPACE% src git clone https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys.git Run `catkin_make`. %CATKIN_WORKSPACE% catkin_make takes minutes depending machine power internet connection) source devel/setup.bash Run command `create_changelog.sh`: rosrun hrpsys create_changelog.sh Documentation RTCs examples [Documentation RTCs examples](https://github.com/start-jsk/hrpsys/tree/master/samples)

package is only available as a single source file for download.  There
are no local modifications to this package.

entries.name: jsk_calibration
entries.description: The jsk_calibration package
entries.readme: jsk_calibration utility package hand/eye calibration [ros-perception/calibration](https://github.com/ros-perception/calibration). package generates sampling poses automaticaly [euslisp](https://github.com/euslisp/jskeus) robot models. Calibrate robot calibration process steps. capture data. Move robot capturing data bag file. roslaunch capture_data.launch estimate parameters. Estimate calibration parameter bag file. ./calibrate_${ROBOT}.sh calibrated urdf file. check progress estimation parameters rviz: rosrun rviz rviz view_results/pose_guesses.rviz ![pose_guesses](imaegs/pose_guesses.png) Update sampling poses HRP2JSKNT ```lisp roseus euslis/hrp2-calibration.l (generate-hrp2jsknt-calibration) Algorithm Sampling joint angles head joints). Sampling distance camera checker board. Sampling agnles axis checker board. Solve target coordinates checker board. Check self-collision. sampling joints angles, compute collision-free poses Choose good poses randomly sparsely Check self-collision interpolated poses Remove colliding poses collision-free poses

entries.name: jsk_footstep_controller
entries.description: The jsk_footstep_controller package
entries.readme: jsk\_footstep\_controller footcoords ![footcoords.png](images/footcoords.png) footcoords publishes frames usefule biped robots. `/ground`: middle coordinate legs. legs `~lleg_end_coords` `~rleg_end_coords`. `/odom_on_ground`: coordinate computing projecting `/odom` plane defined `/ground` frame. transformation updated robot floow checking `lfsensor` `rfsensor` force threshold `~force_threshold`). Subscribing Topics `lfsensosor` (`geometry_msgs/WrenchStamped`) `rfsensosor` (`geometry_msgs/WrenchStamped`) footcoords computes transformation topic timestamp. Publishing Topics (`tf2_msgs/TFMessage`) `~state` (`std_msgs/String`): State robot "air", "ground", "lfoot" "rfoot". Parameters `~output_frame_id` (String, default: `odom_on_ground`) `~parent_frame_id` (String, default: `odom`) `~midcoords_frame_id` (String, default: `ground`) frame\_ids. description frame\_ids. `~lfoot_frame_id` (String, default: `lleg_end_coords`) `~rfoot_frame_id` (String, default: `rleg_end_coords`) frame\_ids effectors legs. `~force_threshold` (Double, default: Force threshold judge leg ground

entries.name: jsk_teleop_joy
entries.description: jsk_teleop_joy
entries.readme: jsk_teleop_joy package Introduction package physical teleoperatoin joy sticks, game controllers MIDI instruments. Supported game controllers package supports game controllers: XBox360 controller Controller (Bluetooth) Controller (USB) order controller Bluetooth, instruction](http://wiki.ros.org/ps3joy/Tutorials/PairingJoystickAndBluetoothDongle). Architecture jsk\_teleop\_joy jsk\_teleop\_joy main script [`joy_main.py`](scripts/joy_main.py)) based plugin architecture. ROS packages plugins jsk\_teleop\_joy plugin represents function pose effector". enable plugins choose plugin "Pushing Select Button". jsk\_teleop\_joy plugins box VerboseStatus JoyPose6D JoyFootstep JoyFootstepPlanner JoyFootstepPlannerDemo JoyMoveIt JoyGoPos implement plugin write xml file define plugins. Export xml file ROS package `manifest.xml` `package.xml`. implement plugin Write xml file define plugins jsk\_teleop\_joy reads plugin definition xml file [`plugin.xml`](plugin.xml). xml ```xml <library> <class name="Foo" type="your_package.foo"> </class> </library> xml file `<library>` tag top level. define plugins `<class>` tag. attribute means plugin. choose plugins launch files ([example](launch/joy.launch#L15)). `type` attribute means python class plugin. jsk\_teleop\_joy instantiate plugin class thie `type` Export xml file ROS package export xml file `<export>` tag `<jsk_teleop_joy>` tag `manifest.xml` `package.xml`. files, [`manifest.xml`](manifest.xml), [`package.xml`](package.xml), good examples. Implement plugin Finally, implement jsk\_teleop\_joy plugin. [VerboseStatus Plugin](src/jsk_teleop_joy/plugin/verbose.py) good implement plugin. `__init__` method plugins required inherits `jsk_teleop_joy.joy_plugin.JSKJoyPlugin` call `JSKJoyPlugin.__init__` `__init__` constructor. ```python class VerboseStatus(jsk_teleop_joy.joy_plugin.JSKJoyPlugin): def __init__(self): jsk_teleop_joy.joy_plugin.JSKJoyPlugin.__init__(self, 'VerbosePlugin') `joyCB` method time jsk\_teleop\_joy receives `/joy` message, calls `joyCB` method active plugin. ```python def joyCB(self, status, history): rospy.loginfo('analog left (status.left_analog_x, status.left_analog_y)) argument `joyCB` instance [`JoyStatus`](src/joy_status.py). `JoyStatus` `XboxStatus`, `PS3Status` `PS3WiredStatus`. means latest message `/joy`. classes provide interface care controller user hand, argument `joyCB` (`history`), sequence `JoyStatus`. instance [`StatusHistory`](src/jsk_teleop_joy/status_history.py). means hisotry `JoyStatus`. SELECT button jsk\_teleop\_joy system occupies SELECT button SELECT button plugin. SELECT button switching plugins. MIDI controllers [`interactive_midi_config.py`](scripts/interactive_midi_config.py) configure MIDI devices script interactively. [movie](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1JOKra7gZVs) Connect MIDI device. script asks device, choose device push buttons/slide faders order `sensor_msgs/Joy`. script maps buttons `sensor_msgs/Joy/axes` `sensor_msgs/Joy/buttons` type quit. configure saved `/tmp/midi.yaml`. [`midi_write.py`](scripts/midi_write.py) order control LEDs active faders, output MIDI commands computer. script `midi_write.py` helps dig command save configuration yaml file option. [`midi_config_player.py`](scripts/midi_config_player.py) script publishes `sensor_msgs/Joy` `/joy` based yaml file configured `interactive_midi_config.py` `midi_write.py`. [`configs`](configs) directory includes yaml files MIDI devices.

entries.name: checkerboard_detector
entries.description:
Uses opencv to find checkboards and compute their 6D poses with respect to the image. Requires the image to be calibrated.
    Parameters:
    display - show the checkerboard detection
    rect%d_size_x - size of checker in x direction
    rect%d_size_y - size of checker in y direction
    grid%d_size_x - number of checkers in x direction
    grid%d_size_y - number of checkers in y direction
    
    There can be more than one grid%d declared, the numbers should grow consecutively starting at 0.

entries.name: imagesift
entries.description:
For every image, computes its sift features and send a new message with the image, its intrinsic parameters, and the features.
    Parameters include:
    display - shows the image on the local computer

entries.name: jsk_pcl_ros
entries.description: jsk_pcl_ros
entries.readme: jsk_pcl_ros Introduction jsk\_pcl\_ros package provide programs [pcl](http://pointclouds.org). package programs nodelet. types jsk\_pcl\_ros message types. ClusterPointIndices.msg Header header pcl_msgs/PointIndices[] cluster_indices ClusterPointIndices represent segmentation result. Simply put, ClusterPointIndices list PointIndices. ModelCoefficientsArray Header header pcl_msgs/ModelCoefficients[] coefficients ModelCoefficientsArray represent coefficients model segmented clusters. Simply put, ModelCoefficientsArray list ModelCoefficients. PolygonArray Header header geometry_msgs/PolygonStamped[] polygons PolygonArray list PolygonStamped. [jsk\_rviz\_plugins](https://github.com/jsk-ros-pkg/jsk_visualization) visualize PolygonArray rviz. BoundingBox Header header geometry_msgs/Pose pose geometry_msgs/Vector3 dimensions BoundingBox represent oriented bounding box. `dimensions` size bounding box. BoundingBoxArray Header header BoundingBox[] boxes BoundingBoxArray list BoundingBox. [jsk\_rviz\_plugins](https://github.com/jsk-ros-pkg/jsk_visualization) visualize BoungingBoxArray rviz. TimeRange Header header time start time Represent range time. nodelets jsk\_pcl/AttentionClipper ![](images/attention_clipper.png) retrives `sensor_msgs/CameraInfo` publish `sensor_msgs/CameraInfo` ROI filled. pose size interest bounding box jsk\_pcl/AttentionClipper returns ROI object. Subscribing Topic `~input` (`sensor_msgs/CameraInfo`) Original camera info. `~pose` (`geometry_msgs/PoseStamped`) pose bounding box. timestamp camera info's timestamp Publishing Topic `~output` (`sensor_msgs/CameraInfo`) camera info `~input` roi field. Parameter `~dimension_x` (Double, default: `~dimension_y` (Double, default: `~dimension_z` (Double, default: Size bounding box jsk\_pcl/ROIClipper ![](images/attention_clipper.png) retrives `sensor_msgs/Image` `sensor_msgs/CameraInfo` publish `sensor_msgs/Image` ROI. similar `image_proc/crop_decimate` `CameraInfo/roi` field ROI. expect jsk\_pcl/ROIClipper jsk\_pcl/AttentionClipper ROI image. Subscribing Topic `~input/image` (`sensor_msgs/Image`) Input image. `~input/camera_info` (`sensor_msgs/CameraInfo`) Camera parameter ROI field filled. topic synchronized. Publishing Topic `~output` (`sensor_msgs/Image`) Image ROI. jsk\_pcl/NormalDirectionFilter ![NormalDirectionFilter](images/normal_direction_filter.png) jsk\_pcl/NormalDirectionFilter filters pointcloud based direction normal. filters pointcloud based **static** direction direction based imu linear_acceleration. Subscribing Topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`) input normal pointcloud. `~input_imu` (`sensor_msgs/Imu`) imu message, enabled `~use_imu` parameter true Publishing Topics `~output` (`pcl_msgs/PointIndices`) result filtering indices. `pcl/ExtractIndices` pointcloud indices. Parameters `~use_imu` (Boolean, default: `False`): Enable `~input_imu` topic set target direction based imu linear acceleration. `~eps_angle` (Double, default: Eps angle difference regard normal required direction. `~angle_offset` (Double, default: Offset parameter direction. `~direction` (Double Array, required): `~use_imu` false, direction parmaeter. jsk\_pcl/MultiPlaneExtraction ![MultiPlaneExtraction](images/multi_plane_extraction.png) Extract points planes `~min_height` `~max_height`. Subscribing Topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Input pointcloud. `~indices` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices`) `~input_polygons` (`jsk_pcl_ros/PolygonArray`) `~input_coefficients` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ModelCoefficientsArray`): input planes. Publishing Topics `~output` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Pointcloud planes `~min_height` `~max_height`. `~output_nonplane_cloud` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Pointcloud planes `~min_height` `~max_height`. Parameters `~min_height` (Double, default: `~max_height`(Double, default: Minimum maximum height polygonal region extract points. `~max_queue_size` (Integer, default: Queue length subscribing topics. jsk\_pcl/RegionGrowingMultiplePlaneSegmentation ![jsk_pcl/RegionGrowingMultiplePlaneSegmentation](images/region_growing_multiple_plane_segmentation.png). jsk\_pcl/RegionGrowingMultiplePlaneSegmentation estimates multiple plenes pointcloud. extracts planes based [region growing](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Region_growing) evaluation function connectivity based equation: ![](images/region_growing_multiple_plane_segmentation_eq.gif) Subscribing Topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): input pointcloud. `~input_normal` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): normal pointcloud `~input` Publishing Topics `~output/inliers` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices`): Set indices polygons. `~output/coefficients` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ModelCoefficientsArray`): Array coefficients polygons. `~output/polygons` (`jsk_pcl_ros/PolygonArray`): Polygons Parameters `~angular_threshold` (Double, default: Angular threshold connect points cluster. `~distance_threshold` (Double, default: Distance threshold connect points cluster. `~max_curvature` (Double, default: extracting planes, filtering points higer curvature `~min_size` (Integer, default: minimum number points plane. `~cluster_tolerance` (Double, default: spatial tolerance cluster candidates. `~ransac_refine_outlier_distance_threshold` (Double, default: Outlier threshold plane estimation RANSAC. `~ransac_refine_max_iterations` (Integer, default: maximum number iterations plane estimation RANSAC. jsk\_pcl/ParticleFilterTracking nodelet track target pointcloud set rviz. Sample run command. roslaunch jsk_pcl_ros tracking_groovy.launch groovy) roslaunch jsk_pcl_ros tracking_hydro.launch hydro) Push "Select" button top bar drag surround target poincloud track rectangle area.Then, finally, push "SelectPointCloudPublishActoin" button SelectPointCloudPublishAction Panel. tracker start tracking target. jsk\_pcl/ResizePointsPublisher ResizePointsPublisher resizes PointCloud generated depth images. *organized* pointcloud. create QVGA pointcloud VGA pointcloud kinect sensors. Subscribing Topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Input PointCloud. input organized pointcloud. Publishing Topics. `~output` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Output PointCloud. output organized. Parameters `~step_x`, `~step_y` (Double, default: Bining step resizing pointcloud. `~not_use_rgb` (Boolean, default: `false`): resize pointcloud RGB fields, set parameter True. jsk\_pcl/PointcloudScreenpoint nodelet convert coordinate image point. retrieves environment pointcloud. Subscribing Topics `~points` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Input pointcloud represent environment organized. `~point` (`geometry_msgs/PointStamped`): Input point represent image coordinate topic enabled `~use_point` parameter set `True`. fileds header frame_id `~use_sync` parameter set `True`, `~points` `~point` synchronized. `~polygon` (`geometry_msgs/PolygonStamped`): Input rectangular region image local coordinates topic enabled `~use_rect` parameter set `True`. fields header frame_id region rectangular. `~use_sync` parameter set `True`, `~point_array` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Input points represent series image coordinate topic enabled `~use_point_array` parameter set `True`. fields header frame_id `~use_sync` parameter set `True`, `~point_array` `~point` synchronized. Publishing Topics `~output_point` (`geometry_msgs/PointStamped`): topic publish point result screenpoint. `~output` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud`): topic publish series points result screenpoint. Advertising Servicies `~screen_to_point` (`jsk_pcl_ros::TransformScreenpoint`) ROS Service interface convert image coordinate point. definition `jsk_pcl_ros::TransformScreenpoint` screen point float32 float32 position actual world std_msgs/Header header geometry_msgs/Point point geometry_msgs/Vector3 vector int service, latest pointcloud acquired `~points` convert point. Parameters `~use_sync` (Boolean, default: `False`): parameter set `True`, timestamps pointcloud target point/rectangle/point array synchronized. `~queue_size` (Integer, default: Queue length subscribing topics. `~crop_size` (Integer, default: size approximate region `~points` pointcloud nan holes. `~use_rect` (Boolean, default: `False`): Enable `~polygon` topic. `~use_point` (Boolean, default: `False`): Enable `~point` topic. `~use_point_array` (Boolean, default: `False`): Enable `~point_array` topic. `~publish_points` (Boolean, default: `False`): Publish result screenpoint `~output` topic. `~publish_point` (Boolean, default: `False`): Publish result screenpoint `~output_point` topic. jsk\_pcl/TiltLaserListener Listen joint_states tilt/spindle laser publish time range scane full space. choose types tilt/spindle lasers tilt-laser infinite spindle laser multisense. Subscribing Topics `~input`(`sensor_msgs/JointState`): Joint angles laser actuator. Publishing Topics `~output` (`jsk_pcl_ros/TimeRange`): Time range scan space. `~output_cloud` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Assembled pointcloud time range `~output`. require `~assemble_scans2` service [laser_assembler](http://wiki.ros.org/laser_assembler). Services `~assemble_scans2` (`laser_assembler/AssembleScans2`): service build pointcloud scan pointcloud. remapped `assemble_scans2` service [laser_assembler](http://wiki.ros.org/laser_assembler). Parameters `~use_laser_assembler` (Boolean, default: `False`): Enable `~output_cloud` `~assemble_scans2`. `~joint_name` (String, **required**): Joint actuator rotate laser. `~laser_type` (String, default: `tilt_half_down`): type rotating laser. choose types: `tilt`: mode tilting laser. mode, TiltLaserListener assumes motor moved minimum joint angle maximum joint angle TiltLaserListener publishes minimum latest time range move tilting laser minimum joint angle maximim joint angle. `tilt_half_down`: mode, TiltLaserListener publishes time range maximum joint angle minimum joint angle. `tilt_half_up`: mode, TiltLaserListener publishes time range minimum joint angle maximum joint angle `tilt_half_down`. `infinite_spindle`: Infinite spindle laser. TiltLaserListener publishes time range rotate laser degrees. `infinite_spindle_half`: Infinite spindle laser, laser degrees range field. rotate laser degrees scan space, degree rotation required. mode, TiltLaserListener publishes time range time range degree rotation. jsk\_pcl/DepthImageCreator Create *organized* pointcloud non-organized pointcloud. Subscribing Topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): input pointcloud reconstructed organized pointcloud. `~info` (`sensor_msgs/CameraInfo`): Put simulated camera `~info` generate organized pointcloud. Publishing Topics `~output` (`sensor_msgs/Image`): Publish organized pointcloud depth image. `~output_cloud` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`) organized pointcloud. `~output_disp` (`sensor_msgs/DisparityImage`) Publish organized pointcloud disparity image. Parameters `~scale_depth` (Double, default: scale depth `~use_fixed_transform` (Boolean, default: `False`): `~translation` (Array double, default: `~rotation` (Array double, default: `~use_fixed_transform` set `True`, transformation `~input` `~info` resolved fixed transformation `~rotation` `translation`. `~use_asynchronous` (Boolean, default: `False`) synchronize `~input` `~info` parameter set `True`. `~use_approximate` (Boolean, default: `False`) Synchronize `~input` `~info` approximately parameter set `True`. `~info_throttle` (Integer, default: number `~info` messages skip generate depth image. `~max_queue_size` (integer, default: Queue length topics. jsk\_pcl/EuclideanClustering ![](images/euclidean_segmentation.png) Segment pointcloud based euclidean metrics, based `pcl::EuclideanClusterExtraction`. nodelet topic interface service interface. result clustering published `jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices`. number cluster changed frames, `EuclideanClustering` track segment. Subscribing Topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): input pointcloud. Publishing Topics `~output` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices`): Result clustering. `~cluster_num` (`jsk_pcl_ros/Int32Stamped`): number clusters. Advertising Services `~euclidean_clustering` (`jsk_pcl_ros/EuclideanSegment`): Service interface segment clusters. sensor_msgs/PointCloud2 input float32 tolerance sensor_msgs/PointCloud2[] output Parameters `~tolerance` (Double, default: Max distance points regarded cluster. `~label_tracking_tolerance` (Double, default: Max distance track cluster frames. `~max_size` (Integer, default: maximum number points cluster. `~min_size` (Integer, default: minimum number points cluster. Sample Plug depth sensor launched openni.launch run command. roslaunch jsk_pcl_ros euclidean_segmentation.launch jsk\_pcl/ClusterPointIndicesDecomposer ![](images/bounding_box.png) Decompose `jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices` array topics `sensor_msgs/PointCloud` `~output00`, `~output01` publishes centroids cluster oriented bounding box direction bounding box aligned nearest planes Subscribing topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Input pointcloud. `~target` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices`): Input set indices represent clusters. `~align_planes` (`jsk_pcl_ros/PolygonArray`): `~align_planes_coefficients` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ModelCoefficientsArray`): planes bounding box aligned Publishing topics `~output%02d` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Series topics pointcloud cluster. `~debug_output` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Concatenate clusters pointcloud colorize cluster result segmentation. `~boxes` (`jsk_pcl_ros/BoundingBoxArray`): Array oriented bounding box segmented cluster. Parameters `~publish_tf` (Boolean, default: `True`): Toggle publishing. `~publish_clouds` (Boolean, default: `True`): Toggle `~output%02d` topics. `~align_boxes` (Boolean, default: `False`): parameter set `True`, `~align_planes` `~align_planes_coefficients` enabled. `~use_pca` (Boolean, default: `False`): Run PCA algorithm cluster estimate direction. jsk\_pcl/ClusterPointIndicesDecomposerZAxis nodelet jsk\_pcl/ClusterPointIndicesDecomposer, sort clusters direction. jsk\_pcl/CentroidPublisher nodelet subscribe sensor\_msgs::PointCloud2, calculate centroid boardcast parent cloud headers frame\_id child centroid frame_id. Subscribing Topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): input pointcloud. Publishing Topics Publish centroid input pointcloud. Parameters `~frame` (String, required): frame_id centroid Sample Plug depth sensor launched openni.launch run command. roslaunch jsk_pcl_ros centroid_publisher.launch jsk\_pcl/OrganizedMultiPlaneSegmentation ![images/organized_multi_plane_segmentation.png](images/organized_multi_plane_segmentation.png) nodelet segments multiple planes **organized** pointcloud. estimates planes based [connected-component analysis](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Connected-component_labeling) `pcl::OrganizedMultiPlaneSegmentation`. ![overview](images/graph/organized_multi_plane_segmentation_overview.png) shows overview pipeline. Estimate normal integral image. Conduct connected component analysis estimate planar regions. Connect neighbor planes normal directions borders planes Refine plane coefficients connected planes based RANSAC. areas planes refinement small, removed. process implemented nodelet order convert pointcloud PCL ROS. Subscribing Topics `~input` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): Input pointcloud. **organized** pointcloud. Publishing topisc `~output` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices`): `~output_polygon` (`jsk_pcl_ros/PolygonArray`): `~output_coefficients` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ModelCoefficientsArray`) inliers, coefficients convex polygons connected polygons. `~output_nonconnected` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices`): `~output_nonconnected_polygon` (`jsk_pcl_ros/PolygonArray`): `~output_nonconnected_coefficients` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ModelCoefficientsArray`) inliers, coefficients polygons polygons connected components analysis. `~output_refined` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ClusterPointIndices`): `~output_refined_polygon` (`jsk_pcl_ros/PolygonArray`): `~output_refined_coefficients` (`jsk_pcl_ros/ModelCoefficientsArray`) inliers, coefficients convex polygons refined polygons. `~output_normal` (`sensor_msgs/PointCloud2`): pointcloud normal `~input` pointcloud. Parameters `~estimate_normal` (Boolean, default: `True`): Estimate normal set `True` `~publish_normal` (Boolean, default: `False`): Publish result normal `~output_normal` `~max_depth_change_factor` (Double, default: depth change threshold computing object borders normal estimation. `~normal_smoothing_size` (Double, default: size area smooth normals (depth dependent `~depth_dependent_smoothing` true) `~depth_dependent_smoothing` (Boolean, default: `False`) Smooth normal depending depth `~estimation_method` (Integer, default: Estimation method normal. choose `AVERAGE_3D_GRADIENT(0)`, `COVARIANCE_MATRIX(1)` `AVERAGE_DEPTH_CHANGE(2)`. `~border_policy_ignore` (Boolean, default: `True`) Ignore border `True` `~min_size` (Integer, default: Minimum number points planar region connected component analysis. recommend smaller size parameter order stable result. `~angular_threshold` (Double, default: `~distance_threshold` (Double, default: Distance angular threshold connected component analysis. `~max_curvature` (Double, default: maximum curvature allowed planar region `~connect_plane_angle_threshold` (Double, default: `~connect_distance_threshold` (Double, default: parameters affect plane connection. OrganizedMultiPlaneSegmentation connects planes normal direction boundaries `~ransac_refine_coefficients` (Boolean, default: `True`) Conduct RANSAC refinment plane true. `~ransac_refine_outlier_distance_threshold` (Double, default: Outlier threshold RANSAC refinment plane. `~min_refined_area_threshold` (Double, default: `~max_refined_area_threshold` (Double, default: Minimum maximum area threshold convex polygon. jsk\_pcl/VoxelGridDownsampleManager jsk\_pcl/VoxelGridDownsampleDecoder jsk\_pcl/Snapit nodelet snap plane real world pointcloud. entries.readme: ROS LEAP MOTION Leap Motion ROS integration REQUIREMENTS ROS Groovy installed including rospy geometry_msg LEAP MOTION SDK Linux FEATURES Release Includes: ros package features extraction hand, recognized LEAP DEVICE. (Vector3) direction.x direction.y direction.z (Vector3) normal.x normal.y normal.z (Point) pos.x pos.y pos.z (Vector3) hand.pitch hand.yaw hand.roll INSTALLATION catkin workspace, follow instructions starting http://www.ros.org/wiki/catkin/Tutorials/create_a_workspace ~/catkin_ws/src git clone https://github.com/warp1337/rosleapmotion.git ~/catkin_ws catkin_make Start roscore shell) leapd shell) append location LeapSDK /lib /lib/x64 PYTHONPATH,e.g., export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:/path/to/SDK/lib:/path/to/SDK/lib/x64 Remember path set "sender" shell. set time, alter leapinterface.py file source ~/catkin_ws/devel/setup.bash rosrun leap_motion sender.py shell) source ~/catkin_ws/devel/setup.bash rosrun leap_motion subscriber.py shell) LEAP MOTION coordinates shell prompt LEAP STEREO CAMERA leap_motion stereo_camera, compiling LeapSDK ver append location LeapSDK /lib /lib/x64 LEAP_SDK_PATH,e.g., add "export LEAP_SDK=/home/Your_name/LeapDebeloperKit_2.*/LeapSDK ~/.bashrc command LeapControlPanel shell enable feature Leap Motion control panel application raw camera images. catkin_ws, catkin_make --only-pkg-with-depth leap_motion roslaunch leap_motion leap_camera.launch roslaunch leap_motion leap_stereo.launch

entries.name: access_point_control
entries.description:
Defines an API for access point control based on 
    dynamic_reconfigure. Other packages must
    implement the API for various access-point models: 
    for example: hostapd_access_point for hostapd-based control or
    linksys_access_point for Linksys router web interface.

entries.name: asmach
entries.description:
SMACH, which stands for 'state machine', is a task-level
    architecture for rapidly creating complex robot behavior. At its
    core, SMACH is a ROS-independent Python library to build
    hierarchical state machines.  SMACH is a new library that takes
    advantage of very old concepts in order to quickly create robust
    robot behavior with maintainable and modular code.

entries.name: asmach_tutorials
entries.description: This package containes numerous examples of how to use SMACH. See the examples directory.

entries.name: ddwrt_access_point
entries.description:
A ROS node that controls a Linksys WRT610Nv2 access point with
    a dd-wrt firmware. Other access points models/dd-wrt versions
    may be compatible as long as the web interface is identical.

entries.name: hostapd_access_point
entries.description:
A ROS node that controls a hostapd-based access
    point. It is mainly intended for use with a wireless 
    network adapter running in master mode. It implements 
    the dynamic_reconfigure interface defined
    in the [[access_point_control]] package.

entries.name: network_detector
entries.description:
A ROS node that watches a given network interface and publishes
     whether it is both UP and RUNNING (indicating that a cable is

     not.

entries.name: network_monitor_udp
entries.description:
Facilities to monitor a network connection by sending UDP packets from
    a client to a server, which bounces them back to the client. The client
    collects statistics on latency and loss. The server is a C standalone utility
    or a ROS node. The client can be a ROS node, a standalone utility or a python class.

entries.name: play_motion
entries.description: Plays a pre-recorded motion on a robot
entries.readme: play_motion tool play pre-recorded motions `ros_control` compliant robots simple actionlib interface. robot implements control `joint_trajectory_controller` put motion `play_motion`. Starting version `play_motion` default compute collision-free trajectory robot's current state motion waypoint. requires robot running [moveit](http://moveit.ros.org/) setup, configure `play_motion` interested motion planning capability, disable altogether. Refer `config/` folder configuration examples. How-to Prepare motion. loaded rosparams. find samples `config/` folder. rosparam load config/your_motion_file.yaml Launch play_motion motion planning capabilities, simplicity) rosparam set /play_motion/disable_motion_planning true rosrun play_motion play_motion Fire actionlib client publishes /play_motion action server, enter motion `motion_name` field set `skip_planning=true` motion planning.

entries.name: pr2_gripper_sensor_action
entries.description:
The pr2_gripper_sensor_action package provides an action interface for talking to the pr2_gripper_sensor_controller real-time controller.

  It provides several different actions for getting high-level sensor information from the PR2 palm-mounted accelerometers, fingertip pressure arrays, and gripper motor/encoder, as well as several sensor-based gripper control actions that respond with low-latency in real-time.
entries.readme: pr2_gripper_sensor_action Gripper sensor action pr2_object_manipulation stack, upgraded hydro pr2_delivery

entries.name: pr2_gripper_sensor_controller
entries.description: The pr2_gripper_sensor_controller package is a real-time controller that integrates signals from the PR2 hand-mounted accelerometer and finger-mounted pressure sensors with motor control of the gripper joint to do highly responsive sensing and low-latency closed-loop control.
entries.readme: pr2_gripper_sensor_controller Gripper sensor controller package pr2_object_manipulation stack. Put seperate compilation pr2_delivery

entries.name: pr2_gripper_sensor_msgs
entries.description:
The pr2_gripper_sensor_msgs package contains various actions and messages that are used in the pr2_gripper_sensor* packages. The structure of the API used by pr2_gripper_sensor_action, and pr2_gripper_sensor_controller packages is as follows: 

Users will send a goal to an Action in the message format of PR2Gripper*Command (where * replaces the name of the particular Action from pr2_gripper_sensor_action). Feedback and Result information for the action is then returned in the format of PR2Gripper*Data.
entries.readme: pr2_gripper_sensor_msgs Put pr2_delivery application, part pr2_object_manipulation stack

entries.name: pr2_hardware_interface
entries.description:
This package contains the C++ interfaces to the PR2 hardware
  components that are controlled over EtherCAT. This includes the
  motors and encoders needed to control the PR2 mechanism, as well as
  components like the pressure sensors in the fingertips, camera
  triggers, etc... All of the hardware components in this interface are
  directly available to the controllers inside the hard realtime
  control loop.

entries.name: lockfree
entries.description:
The lockfree package contains lock-free data structures for use in multithreaded programming.  These
     kinds of data structures are generally not as easy to use as single-threaded equivalents, and are not
     always faster.  If you don't know you need to use one, try another structure with a lock around it
     first.

entries.name: rosatomic
entries.description:
rosatomic provides the C++11-style atomic operations by pulling symbols from the proposed Boost.Atomic
     package into the ros namespace.  Once C++11-style atomics (std::atomic) are available from compilers, rosatomic will
     conditionally use those instead.

entries.readme: INDIGO UPDATE!!! Coming soon....ish. RosJava Tools Build tools rosjava android repositories. includes cmake macros python creation scripts. RosJava Build Demo mkdir ~/rosjava/src ~/rosjava/src catkin_init_workspace wstool init wstool set rosjava_build_tools --git https://github.com/rosjava/rosjava_build_tools hydro-devel wstool set rosjava_core --git https://github.com/rosjava/rosjava_core hydro-devel wstool update ~/rosjava catkin_make `rosjava_core` repo add `package.xml` depends `rosjava_build_tools` `CMakeLists.txt` find_package(catkin REQUIRED rosjava_build_tools) catkin_rosjava_setup() cmake makro sets dummy targets cmake configuration call gradle actual step. parses `package.xml` add target dependencies `build_depends` tag (subsequently letting sequence builds repositories). adds global package `gradle-clean` target. catkin_make Clean single gradle package ~/rosjava/build/rosjava_core gradle-clean-rosjava_core Clean gradle packages ~/rosjava/build gradle-clean Android Build Demo Refer http://ros.org/wiki/rosjava_build_tools. Moving documentation eventually merge rosjava_core android_core documentation.

entries.name: rosruby
entries.description: This package is a Ruby client library for ROS, the Robot Operating System.
entries.readme: ROS Ruby Client: rosruby [ROS](http://ros.org) Robot Operating System developed [OSRF](http://osrfoundation.org/) open source communities. project supports ruby ROS client. program intelligent robots ruby, easily. **Homepage**: http://otl.github.com/rosruby **Git**: http://github.com/OTL/rosruby **Author**: Takashi Ogura **Copyright**: **License**: BSD License **Latest Version**: Requirements ruby ROS (hydro/groovy) electric/fuerte electric fuerte, Install (binary) ```bash sudo apt-get install ros-hydro-rosruby source /opt/ros/hydro/setup.bash ruby library path. Install source Install ROS ruby ROS document [http://ros.org/wiki/ROS/Installation](http://ros.org/wiki/ROS/Installation) rosruby genrb message generation. install genrb, message files automatically compiled message source package exists catkin_ws/src directory. rosruby catkin. catkin_ws read wiki](http://wiki.ros.org/ROS/Tutorials/InstallingandConfiguringROSEnvironment). ````bash ~/catkin_ws/src git clone git://github.com/OTL/genrb.git git clone git://github.com/OTL/rosruby.git ~/catkin_ws catkin_make Message generation generate ROS msg/srv files rosruby msg/srv packages compiled source. catkin package, easy. add package CMakeLists.txt. find_package(rosruby) rosruby_generate_messages(message_pkg1 message_pkg2 generate manually. msg/srv generation script (rosruby_genmsg.py) order generage rosruby messages. replace `catkin_ws` catkin workspace) ```bash rosrun rosruby rosruby_genmsg.py geometry_msgs nav_msgs ~/catkin_ws/devel/lib/ruby/vendor_ruby/ generate msg/srv files source project), automatically generated [genrb](http://github.com/OTL/genrb). Sample Source rosruby sample programs [rosruby_tutorials](https://github.com/OTL/rosruby_common) package. Subscriber ```ruby #!/usr/bin/env ruby require 'ros' require 'std_msgs/String' node ROS::Node.new('/rosruby_sample_subscriber') node.subscribe('/chatter', Std_msgs::String) |msg| puts "message \'#{msg.data}\'" node.ok? node.spin_once sleep(1) Publisher ```ruby #!/usr/bin/env ruby require 'ros' require 'std_msgs/String' node ROS::Node.new('/rosruby_sample_publisher') publisher node.advertise('/chatter', Std_msgs::String) msg Std_msgs::String.new node.ok? msg.data rosruby!: publisher.publish(msg) sleep(1.0) Note Ruby requires 'Start Capital letter' class module names. **S**td_msgs::String class **s**td_msgs::String. rosruby message compiler automatically generates messages rule. Samples [rosruby_common](https://github.com/OTL/rosruby_common) actionlib tutorials. tests [![Build Status](https://secure.travis-ci.org/OTL/rosruby.png)](http://travis-ci.org/OTL/rosruby) Install packages tests. ```bash sudo apt-get install rake gem sudo gem install yard redcarpet simplecov run tests. ```bash rake test Documents generate API documents yard. Document generation yard redcarpet. install gem command ```bash gem install yard redcarpet generate documentds. ```bash rake yard access generated documents [here](http://otl.github.com/rosruby/doc/). catkin CMakeLists.txt rosruby's CMakeLists.txt defines macros package rosruby. add `find_package(rosruby)` CMakeLists.txt. rosruby_setup() setup macros variables rosruby rosruby_generate_messages(message_pkg1 message_okg2 generates rosruby msg/srv files rosruby_add_libraries(files dirs) install lib files devel environment.

entries.name: hrpsys_ros_bridge
entries.description: hrpsys_ros_bridge package provides basic functionalities to bind
entries.readme: hrpsys\_ros\_bridge Introduction hrpsys\_ros\_bridge package connect `hrpsys <http://wiki.ros.org/hrpsys>`_ (OpenRTM-based controller) system ROS system. package ROSBridge `hrpsys`, cmake_libraries, launch files, Euslisp interface, examples. ROSBridge ROSBridge ROS node bridge `hrpsys` system ROS system. check "bridging" software ROS `rosbridge_suite <http://wiki.ros.org/rosbridge_suite>`_ JSON API ROS functionality non-ROS programs. `rtmbuild <http://wiki.ros.org/rtmbuild?distro=hydro>`_ ROS-like compile launch script `OpenRTM`. `OpenRTM` resources ROS interface, OpenRTM ``Data Ports`` ROS ``Topic`` OpenRTM ``Servie Ports`` ROS ``Service``. table shows concepts worlds. ROS OpenRTM Process ROS Node RTC Data connection Topic Data Port RPC connection Service Service Port HrpsysSeqStateROSBridge Publish ROS topics reading RTC's data ports. Send ROS JointTrajectory service ``SequencePlayer.rtc`` service ports. Generated ROSBridges: `openrtm_ros_bridge` ROS bridge code `openrtm_aist` `hrpsys_ros_bridge` ROS bridge `hrpsys` package. bridges ROS service OpenRTM service port. idl files `hrpsys` coped ``hrpsys_ros_bridge/idl/*.idl``, generates cpp codes ``hrpsys_ros_bridge/src_gen/*.cpp`` built binaries ``hrpsys_ros_bridge/[bin,lib]``. cmake libraries [``hrpsys_ros_bridge/cmake/compile_robot_model.cmake``] (https://github.com/start-jsk/rtmros_common/blob/master/hrpsys_ros_bridge/cmake/compile_robot_model.cmake) CMake file convert robot model file format. launch files [``hrpsys_ros_bridge/launch/hrpsys_ros_bridge.launch``] (https://github.com/start-jsk/rtmros_common/blob/master/hrpsys_ros_bridge/launch/hrpsys_ros_bridge.launch) launch file invoke ROSBridges connect RTCs. Euslisp interface [Euslisp Interface] (https://github.com/start-jsk/rtmros_common/blob/master/hrpsys_ros_bridge/euslisp/README.md) Examples ``hrpsys_ros_bridge/test/test-samplerobot.test``

entries.name: eusgazebo
entries.description: The eusgazebo package
entries.maintainers: Kei Okada Masaki Murooka Kei Okada
entries.readme: EusGazebo Integration Euslisp Gazebo simulation. Gazebo simulation interactively Euslisp interpreter. Usage ```lisp initialize init eusgazebo (setq *eusgazebo-server* (instance eusgazebo :init)) generate eus model (setq *obj* (generate-eus-model-function)) add eus mdoel eusgazebo (send *eusgazebo-server* :add-model *obj*) simulate set simulation setting (send *obj* :newcoords (make-coords :pos (send *eusgazebo-server* :pause-sim) (send *eusgazebo-server* :eus2gzb) start simulation (send *eusgazebo-server* :unpause-sim) (send *eusgazebo-server* :gzb2eus-loop) Sample ```bash roscore roscd eusgazebo/samples roseus fall-arrow-object-simulation.l "(fall-arrow-object-simulation)" roseus play-pinball-simulation.l "(progn (init-pinball-simulation) (play-pinball-simulation))" roseus play-domino-simulation.l "(progn (init-domino-simulation) (play-domino-simulation))" ROS Test ```bash rostest eusgazebo test-fall-arrow-object-simulation.test rostest eusgazebo test-play-domino-simulation.test

entries.name: segbot
entries.description:
ROS drivers for controlling Segway RMP 50 based robots at Learning Agents 
    Research Group (LARG), AI Laboratory, Department of Computer Science, 
    The University of Texas at Austin.

entries.name: segbot_bringup
entries.description:
Contains launch files and runtime scripts necessary for running
    segbots in simulation and in the real world.

entries.name: segbot_description
entries.description:
Contains URDF descriptions of all robot components and sensors for the
    segbot, as well as all the different sensor configurations for a segbot.

entries.name: segbot_firmware
entries.description: Arduino firmware for BWI segbot sensor array.
entries.authors: Jose Bigio Jack O'Quin Tim Eckel (NewPing library)
entries.readme: Segbot Arduino firmware package Arduino firmware UTexas BWI segbot sensor array. Access Serial Ports access Arduino serial port, authorized "dialout" group. verify member group, run command: grep dialout group, "dialout" printed output. authorized, run command personal Ubuntu system: sudo usermod dialout your_user_id run command BWI robots lab machines. maintain shared user group database, system administrator update case, logout login group membership updated, verify "dialout" group. Build Install CMakeLists.txt support install command line. build install firmware Arduino board, install Arduino development tools. Ubuntu, run commands: sudo apt-get install arduino mkdir ~/sketchbook ~/sketchbook $(rospack find segbot_firmware)/src/libraries Plug USB cable, run Arduino GUI: arduino Select ``File Sketchbook Libraries`` desired firmware version. standard named ``segbot_arduino``. click icon compile microcode load controller. ROS Driver firmware loaded, run ROS device driver: roslaunch segbot_sensors arduino.launch --screen Sensor ranges published point clouds ``/range_points`` topic. points, run [rviz](http://wiki.ros.org/rviz), displaying topic "sensor_base" frame reference decay time seconds.

entries.name: segbot_sensors
entries.description:
Contains sensor specific launch files and all the relevant filters that are
    applied on sensor data before being used by the segbot.

entries.name: segbot_apps
entries.description:
High-level applications that run on Segway RMP 50 based robots at Learning
    Agents Research Group (LARG), AI Laboratory, Department of Computer
    Science, The University of Texas at Austin.

entries.name: segbot_gui
entries.description:
Displays a simple GUI to the user. The GUI is capable of displaying a simple
    message or image to the user, and ask a question. The message and question
    plugins are also written in this package.

entries.name: segbot_logical_translator
entries.description:
High-level navigation application for the segbot allowing the segbot to
    approach and gothrough doors. The application can also be used to determine
    the segbot's logical location, as well as sense when a door in front of the
    robot is open or not.

entries.name: segbot_navigation
entries.description:
Contains launch files for running the ROS navigation stack on the segbot
    using the eband_local_planner approach, as well as launch files for amcl
    and gmapping.

entries.name: uwsim
entries.description: UWSim is an UnderWater SIMulator for marine robotics research and development. UWSim visualizes an underwater virtual scenario that can be configured using standard modeling software. Controllable underwater vehicles, surface vessels and robotic manipulators, as well as simulated sensors, can be added to the scene and accessed externally through ROS interfaces. This allows to easily integrate the visualization tool with existing control architectures.

entries.name: uwsim

UWSim visualizes an underwater virtual scenario that can be configured using standard modeling software. This allows to easily integrate the visualization tool with existing control architectures.

entries.name: vrmagic_ros_bridge_server
entries.description:
This Package contains a ROS-brige for the VRMagic Smartcameras. There is a
	ROS-node (vrmagic_ros_bridge_server), which is the Server for the ROS-brige,
  	and firmware for the VRMagic Smartcam. On the Smartcam the User have to implement a firmware and have	
	to use the Class VrMagicHandler_camhost for communication with the vrmagic_ros_bridge_server.
	Each Image which is transmitted to the vrmagic_ros_bridge_server by using the Class VrMagicHandler_camhost
  	will be published as Image via ROS. Multiple Images are also possible.

entries.name: wxpython_swig_interface
entries.description:
Interface files used with SWIG to allow use of custom C++ widgets with wxPython code.

    These interface files were pulled from wxPython 2.8.1, because at the time that was the target version (since we were using Ubuntu Feisty).
    We will probably continue to use these interface files until they no longer work for some reason.

    The ideal situation would be if these were installed in system installs along with wxPython, but unfortunately they are not.
